    * The apparatus includes a probe with fiber optics for small area measurements.
* The probe has a casing with an aperture and optical conductors.
    * The apparatus is easy to handle and does not require precise positioning.
    * Light emitting and receiving devices are connected to a measuring device.
    * Correction means compensate for variations in emitted light and ambient light.
* The apparatus uses synchronous detection for measuring reflectance.
    * A micro-computer processes the measurements and displays the reflectance value.
    * Calibration is done by measuring different surfaces for reference values.
    * The apparatus provides accurate and objective quantification of skin reflectance.
</summary>

<summary>
* Dental apparatus for cleaning and massaging teeth
  * Traditional brushing, toothpicks, and flossing are not enough to prevent caries and peridental disease
  * Hydro-therapy devices have been introduced for better cleansing
* Mouthpiece design with upper and lower channel members
  * Membrane structure connects the channel members
  * Pneumatic means provide massaging action on the gums
* Bite blocks hold teeth in place during massaging
  * Air-sacks inflate and deflate to move channel members for massaging
  * Water or cleaning fluid is provided through hoses for cleaning and lubrication
* Control box with switches for air, water, or both
  * Remote control device for easy operation
  * Suction hoses remove excess fluid during use
* Modifications can be made to the design for added features
  * Bristles can be added for additional massaging action
  * Single coupling arrangement can be used for convenience
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to pelvic floor reconstruction using implants.
	* Pelvic organ prolapse (POP) is a common female problem affecting quality of life.
		* Weak or damaged muscles and tissues cause pelvic organs to shift out of position.
		* Surgical reconstruction involves repositioning organs and using synthetic mesh implants.
		* Current procedures may not provide reliable anchoring of the mesh implant.
	* The invention provides a needle for threading implants through tissue from the accessible side.
		* The needle traps the strap, threads it through the tissue, and releases the trap.
		* An anterior implant includes straps for threading into ligaments and a loop for anchoring to the cervix.
	* A posterior implant includes straps for threading into ligaments and loops for anchoring to the cervix and perineal body.
		* Both implants can be used for reconstructing various pelvic organs.
		* The needle operation allows threading from the accessible side without additional perforations.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention discloses methods and apparatus for providing ventilatory assistance matched to a subject's respiratory need.
   • The invention is suitable for spontaneously breathing human subjects requiring long-term ventilatory assistance, especially during sleep.
   • Known ventilatory devices often do not accurately match the amplitude and phase of mask pressure to the subject's spontaneous efforts.
• The invention aims to address goals such as matching assistance to the subject's efforts, adjusting assistance to maintain ventilation, and providing immunity to sudden leaks.
   • The invention calculates the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle as a continuous variable.
   • Methods are disclosed for calculating the instantaneous phase, determining average respiratory rate, and providing ventilatory assistance.
   • The apparatus includes transducers, processor means, flow generators, and gas delivery means.
• The invention uses fuzzy logic algorithms to adjust the degree of assistance based on the subject's needs.
   • Different embodiments cater to subjects with varying respiratory mechanics, abnormal chemoreceptor reflexes, or hypoventilation syndromes.
   • The apparatus measures flow and pressure, calculates mask pressure and flow, and adjusts settings dynamically.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an electro-surgical dissecting and cauterizing instrument for laparoscopic/endoscopic procedures.
	• Surgeons use electro-surgical instruments to remove tissue and cauterize bleeding tissue.
• The instrument includes a rigid arm extending between the working tip electrode and the insulating sleeve.
	• The arm is laterally offset from the sleeve to reduce obstruction of the surgeon's view.
• An insulating layer covers the entire length of the tool up to the working tip electrode to prevent unintentional cauterization.
• The instrument is designed for easy handling and is disposable for endoscopic procedures.
• Different embodiments of the instrument have varying arm lengths and working tip electrode configurations to suit different surgical needs.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a magnetic resonance imaging apparatus with a magnet, patient receptacle, support plate, transmit/receive coils, and adjustable exposure positions.
	• Known MRI apparatuses require adjustment of exposure parameters for different positions, leading to readjustment of the apparatus.
• The adjustment optimizes the RF chain and magnetic field homogeneity in the imaging volume.
	• Patient-dependent adjustments are necessary for safety and image quality.
• Automatic recognition of required adjustments in conventional MRI machines takes 10-90 seconds per exposure position.
	• In some cases, adjustments are not feasible due to time constraints or contrast agent tracking.
• The present invention determines adjustment parameters in advance and stores them for subsequent exposures.
	• This allows for high-contrast exposures in a shorter time, reducing the need for readjustments during imaging.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to fasteners for albums like photographic albums and scrapbooks.
	* Conventional albums use male and female screws for fastening, which can be inconvenient.
* The new fastener includes strap anchors on the front and back covers, a strap passing through aligned apertures, and a releasable connection for adjusting the length of the strap.
	* The strap anchors are channels where the strap is snap-locked to prevent displacement.
	* The strap has formations that engage with the channel to prevent longitudinal movement.
* The strap enters the channel through an aperture in the base, ensuring correct location between the strap anchor and the cover.
* The album can have multiple fasteners along the spine, allowing for easy insertion and removal of pages.
	* Straps can be adhesively attached to the covers for convenience.
* The fasteners are cost-effective, easy to use, and have a low profile to not interfere with the album cover closure.
	* A modified embodiment includes saw-tooth profile ribs for improved strap fixation in the channel.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a sulky with two wheels on the same axis, designed for trotting races.
	• Sulkies need to be lightweight, easy-running, and durable.
		• Traditional sulkies are welded steel constructions, but attempts with aluminum have failed due to poor strength.
		• Conventional sulkies have shafts fastened inside the wheels, making them unsuitable for light metals.
		• The new sulky design allows for assembly from flat elements, easy storage, and transportation.
• The sulky is built from casted elements and extruded profiles for stability and strength.
	• End frames are casted to integrate wheel suspension, shaft fastening, and crossbar connections.
		• This design allows for mass production and lower expenses.
		• The sulky weight is reduced by approximately 40%.
		• Color tapes can be applied for individual color display.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a ventilation system for rotating water feeds, particularly in water-cooled generators with coaxial feed and discharge ducts.
	* Prior to operation, air must be removed from the cooling system to prevent overheating and blockages.
		* Overheating can lead to steam bubbles clogging flow paths.
		* Existing systems lack ventilation for rotating parts like water feeds.
		* The invention aims to automatically remove air bubbles from rotating pipes.
* The invention includes a bypass with at least one inlet and outlet between the feed and discharge ducts.
	* Bypass inlets open into the space around the axis of rotation to remove air bubbles.
		* Bypasses can be arranged in end faces of feed ducts or as radially arranged pipe members.
		* Bypasses can also be coiled pipes or include means to increase hydrodynamic resistance.
* Different embodiments of the invention are shown in schematic diagrams.
	* Bypasses are designed to transport air bubbles from the axis of rotation to the discharge duct.
		* Bypasses can be T-shaped, have spiral grooves for throttling, or be arranged at various points in the feed duct.
		* Coiled pipe bypasses act as throttles and can be placed in different sections of the feed duct.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a steering column for a motor vehicle with a jacket unit supporting a steering shaft and a retaining part connected through an energy absorption and break-away connection.
    * The jacket unit is prestressed with respect to the retaining part in the displacement direction parallel to the longitudinal axis, reducing the force peak during a crash.
    * The energy absorption connection comprises at least one bending wire or strip, while the break-away connection is implemented with a shear bolt for releasing the connection in case of a crash.
    * The securement device allows for length and height adjustment of the steering column, with the retaining part connected to the bracket unit for stability.
    * The bending wire or strip is elastically deformed to absorb energy during a crash, providing a safe and adjustable steering column design.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a method for mounting glass panels in curved window bays of vehicles using flat, uncurved glass panels.
	• Continuation of prior applications filed in 1987 and 1988.
• Conventional methods involve pre-contouring and tempering glass panels, making them less flexible and more brittle.
	• Pre-contoured glass is stronger against perpendicular shock but weaker in flexibility.
	• Flat glass panels are less rigid, more flexible, and less likely to shatter in accidents.
• Pre-contoured glass can lead to vehicular body collapse in accidents due to lack of structural support.
	• Flat glass panels are significantly cheaper than pre-treated, pre-contoured glass.
• The method involves flexing flat glass panels to fit curved window openings in vehicles.
	• Adhesive sealant is applied to hold the glass in place permanently.
	• Fastening means include resilient clips and reveal molding to maintain the flexed glass in position.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an apparatus for removing a gas from a liquid, particularly suited for offshore hydrocarbon recovery platforms.
  * The apparatus includes a vessel with multiple gasification chambers, gas ingesting and mixing mechanisms, and vents for removing gas.
* The method involves introducing a flow of liquid with a first gas, using gas ingesting mechanisms to displace the first gas with a second gas, and removing the displaced gas from the liquid.
  * The process results in reduced vessel height requirements, decreased capital costs, and efficient removal of oxygen from water.
</summary>

<summary>
• The packaging machine disclosed has a shaft driven in the production direction, synchronizing movements of tool members in different work stations.
	• Transfer mechanisms convert the shaft's rotational movement into the required tool member movement.
• Toggle levers or cam mechanisms are used in the transfer mechanisms for robustness and effective force transfer.
	• Wear-reducing elements are included in the cam mechanisms to reduce wear on the transfer mechanism and shaft.
• The shaft can be continuously rotated or alternately rotated for different tool member movements.
	• Work stations like forming, sealing, and cutting stations can be included in the packaging machine.
• Two work stations can be arranged on different vertical levels for a more compact design.
	• Frames are provided to support the shaft and prevent vibrations in the packaging machine.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to finishing articles with a mounting hub for quick attachment to a power tool.
	• The problem of accidental disassociation of the article from the drive means is addressed.
• Traditional methods of securing grinding wheels to drive shafts involve multiple loose parts and tools for removal.
	• Adhesive was used to affix mounting hubs to grinding wheels, but rotational movement could occur.
• Keyways and key structures were developed to prevent rotational movement between hub and wheel.
	• Various patents show different approaches to securing finishing articles to drive shafts.
• The invention introduces a drive member assembly with a backing flange, retaining nut, and pressure cap.
	• The assembly provides compression to securely hold the grinding wheel in place during use.
• The pressure cap is easily snapped into place and remains on the wheel for disposal.
	• The assembly is lightweight, vibration-free, and cost-effective compared to traditional methods.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is based on a generic hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system.
    * The hydraulic unit diverts pressure fluid entrained by pump pistons away from vulnerable electrical components.
    * A pressure equalization conduit is created between the spring chambers and the motor's interior to prevent damage from pressure fluid and ensure operability.
* The housing block can be immersed in water without risk of damage due to the design of the unit.
    * Dual utilization of conduit portions allows for cost savings in production.
    * The unit can be easily adapted for different functionalities by adjusting the size of the containers for pressure fluid storage.
* Pressure equalization between the motor and covering hood is achieved through a cable sheath, preventing water ingress and protecting electrical components.
    * The cable sheath acts as a pressure equalization conduit between the housing and the motor.
    * Sealing elements and support elements ensure a secure and effective pressure equalization system.
</summary>

<summary>
* Power and free conveyor systems involve transferring carriers between predetermined paths.
	* Transfer is achieved by providing pusher dogs that are normally held out of operative position by the track.
* A third dog is provided in addition to the first and second dogs for selective transfer over short or long distances.
	* The third dog is normally urged to an operative pushing position but is held out of position by the track.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a grounding product for railroad car center plate assembly bowl liners made of ultra high molecular weight polyethylene with added conductive material.
	• The liner eliminates the need for lubrication and provides effective grounding without additional apparatus.
		• The liner is conductive, composed of UHMW-PE mixed with 2% carbon black.
		• The liner fills the space between the truck bolster bowl and body bolster center plate to prevent movement.
		• The liner has self-lubricating properties and meets electrical conductivity standards.
• The liner configuration includes a dished, bowl-like design with upstanding side walls and a floor portion.
	• The liner forms slip surfaces to ensure swiveling action of the car trucks.
		• The liner has primary and secondary slip surfaces for smooth movement.
		• The liner is resilient to loads and resists compaction under compression.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a gate valve for dispensing viscous substances from flexible bags or pouches.
	• It can be operated with one hand, making it ideal for fast-food restaurants.
• The valve includes a tubular sleeve with a guide and a reciprocable gate for controlling the flow.
	• The gate moves over the discharge outlet to provide variable flow and complete cut-off.
• The valve is mounted on the spout of a bag and can be disassembled for cleaning.
	• It has sealing ribs for a secure fit and a sharp sealing edge for effective sealing.
• The gate valve member is curved to complement the guide plate for a tight seal.
	• It can be easily moved between opened and closed positions with one hand.
• The valve functions when the bag is inclined in a dispenser and allows for gradual or quick flow control.
	• It can be disassembled for cleaning and reassembled easily.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a vehicle rearview mirror system that is tolerant of different protocols of an output of a vehicle control.
    • The mirror control determines the protocol of the output of the vehicle control by monitoring the output and attempting to conclude the state of the output.
    • The mirror control may include a microcomputer with software processing to determine the protocol.
    • The system can be used with various types of vehicles with modifications to the circuit.
• The system utilizes a logical sequence of events to determine the protocol of the output of the vehicle control.
    • The protocol is established based on the assumption of the vehicle state, such as whether the vehicle is in reverse gear or not.
    • Parameters like reverse-inhibit-running average and reverse-inhibit-ignition-cycle average are maintained and compared to determine the protocol.
    • The technique is implemented in software, reducing hardware expenses and utilizing existing microcomputer resources in the mirror control system.
</summary>

<summary>
* Anti-dive unit controls front fork contraction in response to front wheel brake operation
    * Suppresses front fork contraction to increase grounding load on front wheel
    * Minimizes chassis vibration, improves braking efficiency, and reduces angular deceleration variations
* Anti-lock control unit increases and decreases hydraulic braking pressure for front wheel brake
    * Downward load on front fork causes contraction
    * Anti-dive unit restricts front fork contraction to enhance braking efficiency
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a partition system for refrigerated trailers, railcars, or containers to separate cargo areas at different temperatures.
	* The system includes movable panels that can be independently attached to mounting assemblies.
		* Panels can be slidably attached to ceiling-mounted rails for independent movement.
		* Panels can be raised and secured to the ceiling when not in use.
		* Various mounting mechanisms can be used for attachment to rails.
		* Rails can be mounted on walls or ceilings for different opening configurations.
	* Panels can be used individually or together to create different cargo areas.
		* Panels can be fastened together to form a full-width bulkhead.
		* Each panel can be independently raised and lowered with minimal clearance.
		* Panels can be secured together with straps, buckles, or other mechanisms.
	* The system allows for efficient multi-temperature transport of perishable goods.
		* Reduces strain on refrigeration units and transportation costs.
		* Provides flexibility in dividing cargo areas based on temperature requirements.
		* Can be customized with additional rails or panels for specific needs.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a sanitizable rotary valve for liquid chromatography applications.
    • The valve allows for intermittent flushing and cleaning without disassembly.
    • A unique diaphragm seal design allows for partial separation of rotor-stator faces for cleaning.
    • The valve includes barrier fluid flow paths to prevent leakage and accumulation of dried material.
• The valve is designed for use in simulated moving bed chromatography systems.
    • It can be used for counter-current flow processes to separate components in a liquid stream.
    • The valve allows for efficient separation of slow and fast components in the feed stream.
    • Different configurations of the valve can be used for various chromatographic separation processes.
</summary>

<summary>
* Gas-liquid contacting trays are improved with directional thrust valves for higher efficiency operation.
    * Trays in distillation columns are commonly used for separating components in a multicomponent stream.
        * Trays can have high pressure drop and liquid hold-up, affecting efficiency.
        * Structured packing is energy efficient but can be difficult to operate consistently.
        * Different tray configurations, such as cross-flow and counter flow, impact vapor-liquid contact.
        * Multiple downcomer trays and sieve trays are used to increase vapor/liquid handling capacity.
    * Directional thrust valves on trays help control liquid flow and enhance vapor-liquid contact.
        * Circular disc valves with wider frontal legs divert liquid flow around the aperture.
        * The valves reduce back-trapping of liquid and promote directional vapor flow.
        * The valves are designed to increase tray efficiency and reduce turbulence.
        * Alternative stationary aperture covers with wider lead legs can also be used for the same purpose.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure.
	* It reduces variances in output pressure due to large differences in input pressure.
	* The assembly is inexpensive to manufacture and maintain.
	* It is lightweight and portable.
	* It reduces the size and cost of a regulator needed to regulate fluid pressure.
	* The assembly includes a vane motor that converts pressurized fluid into mechanical power.
	* The vane motor can be used to generate electricity for various applications, such as driving a rotisserie on a gas grill or powering a headlight for a scuba diver.
</summary>

<summary>
* Pallet system designed to support trays with side supports, using raised guide rails to limit lateral movement
  * Guide rails are raised above the pallet surface and spaced to straddle tray side supports
  * End stops on the pallet limit longitudinal movement of trays
* Stacked pallet system includes end plates for stability and protection, trays are laterally interlocked
  * End plates secured to trays by wrapping, shaped to complement tray contours
* Method of loading pallet involves sliding trays onto guide rails, using end stops to position trays
  * Trays are laterally interlocked and end plates are secured to stack of trays
* Components made of plastic, customizable for different tray sizes and shapes
  * Pallet cap and end plates made from plastic, manufactured using methods like thermoforming or injection molding
</summary>

<summary>
* The electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension includes a compact and efficient magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system.
	* The system consists of magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail.
* The design aims to avoid contact and friction between the high-speed rotary wing and the saucer shell, reduce noise and vibration, and increase power efficiency.
	* The system utilizes repulsive or attractive magnetic suspension bearings in both radial and axial directions.
* Two improvement solutions are proposed to overcome reactive torque: coaxial axial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings and coaxial radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings.
	* These solutions ensure stable power control and offset reactive torque during rotation.
* The electric engine of the flying saucer is designed as a permanent magnet synchronous motor, providing a simple and efficient structure for propulsion.
	* The rotor consists of pairs of permanent magnets embedded in the magnetic suspension outer ring to form an exciter field.
</summary>

<summary>
• Streptavidin muteins with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands were identified through a screening process.
	• Two muteins, designated as "1" and "2", showed significantly higher affinity compared to wild-type streptavidin.
	• The muteins were produced on a preparative scale and used in affinity chromatography and ELISA experiments.

</summary>

<summary>
• Methods of forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts are described.
    • Guanylating agents such as thioureas or isothioureas are reacted with amines or pyrrolidines in the presence of a nickel catalyst.
    • Nickel catalysts in the zero oxidation state derived from various alloys or substrates are preferred.
    • The reactions are carried out under mild conditions to achieve high yields of guanidines.
    • The use of nickel catalysts allows for the reuse of the catalyst and minimizes the use of toxic reagents in drug production.

</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus and method for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires.
	* The method involves anodizing the aluminum strip or wire and then electrolytically coloring the anodic coating.
* Conventional methods for coloring aluminum have issues with weatherability and fading over time.
	* These methods involve degreasing, anodization, and dyeing with organic dyes.
* The new method involves anodizing in an electrolytic bath containing specific acids or salts for coloring.
	* This results in colored oxide films with high weather resistance.
* The apparatus includes baths for degreasing, etching, anodic oxidation, electrolytic coloring, and sealing.
	* The aluminum strip or wire is continuously passed through these baths.
* The anodic oxidation bath uses sulfuric acid to form an oxide film on the aluminum.
	* The thickness of the oxide film influences the color obtained during electrolytic coloring.
* The electrolytic coloring bath contains salts like nickel, cobalt, copper, tin, or selenious acid for coloring.
	* Different combinations of components result in various colors.
* The aluminum strip or wire acts as a cathode in the electrolytic coloring bath during d.c. electrolysis.
	* The current density and electrolysis time determine the color achieved.
* The apparatus allows for continuous and cost-effective production of colored aluminum strips or wires with superior weather resistance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention describes a process of producing transgenic plants transformed on a chromosome by assembling a DNA sequence of interest from at least two different vectors in planta.
    * The process involves providing plant cells with vectors adapted for site-specific recombination and integration into the chromosome.
    * The DNA sequence of interest contains sequence portions from the vectors necessary for expressing a function of interest.
    * Transgenic plants expressing the function of interest are selected.
* The process allows for efficient, rapid, and versatile transformation of plants, screening of DNA libraries, gene function analysis, and directed evolution.
    * It enables in planta assembly of complex DNA sequences, optimization of gene expression units, and screening for optimal regulatory sequences.
    * Different allelic vectors can be generated from the assembled DNA sequence for further applications.
    * The transgenic plants produced can be used for various purposes in agriculture, biotechnology, and research.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor for compressing refrigerant gas by rotating a swash plate, with an improvement of applying a fluorocarbon coating to reduce frictional wear.
    * Swash plate compressors have been used in automotive air conditioning systems for many years, with the swash plate rotating about a shaft and reciprocating pistons arranged radially around it.
    * Coatings have been used on aluminum swash plates to reduce wear, with prior coatings requiring high silicon aluminum base materials and complex electroplating processes.
    * The present invention provides a coating with a polyfluoro elastomer bonded directly to aluminum, lubricious and load bearing additives, allowing the use of lower cost aluminum materials without electroplating.
    * The coating is applied through liquid spray, with the polyfluoro elastomer cross-linking at an elevated temperature to form a durable and low friction surface.
    * The coating does not require a highly polished surface on the swash plate, as roughened surfaces aid in mechanical adhesion of the coating.
    * Experimental results show that the coated swash plates have significantly higher seizure loads compared to uncoated or tin-coated swash plates.
    * Curing times and temperatures affect the durability of the coating, with optimal conditions being around 10 minutes at 450°F.
    * The coated swash plates exhibit a low friction coefficient throughout testing, outperforming uncoated and tin-coated swash plates.
    * The coating thickness is approximately 0.0012 inches, with thinner coatings possible based on surface roughness and thicker coatings not recommended due to reduced durability under high loads.
</summary>

<summary>
* Polymers of the present invention are designed for use in anti-reflective coatings in semiconductor devices to prevent light reflection during photolithography processes.
    * The polymers can be prepared from specific chemical compounds, dissolved in organic solvents, and coated on wafers to form a cross-linked anti-reflective layer.
    * The anti-reflective coatings eliminate CD variations, improve product yield, and are stable under conventional photolithographic conditions.
    * The polymers have high solubility in hydrocarbon solvents, but become insoluble after hard-baking, making them suitable for use in photoresist films.
</summary>

<summary>
• A white film made from polyethylene terephthalate with titanium dioxide, UV stabilizer, and flame retardant is produced with good mechanical properties and UV resistance.
	• The film passes fire tests, has high gloss, low light transmission, and does not embrittle on exposure to heat.
• Multilayer films with different layer compositions are also produced with similar properties, fulfilling fire test requirements and showing good weathering resistance.
	• Thermoformability is achieved without predrying, allowing for the production of detailed moldings.
</summary>

<summary>
• The CrF3 catalyst was effective in hydrofluorinating 142b to 143a with high conversion and selectivity.
    • Conversion and selectivity remained high even in the presence of 141b and HCl.
    • Lowering the contact time did not significantly affect the conversion and selectivity.
    • The Cr/Ni/AlF3 catalyst also showed high efficiency in hydrofluorinating 142b to 143a.
    • The catalyst was durable and could be regenerated by heating in air.
    • Adiabatic hydrofluorination at different temperatures and pressures resulted in high conversion and selectivity to 143a.
    • The process was effective in removing olefinic compounds from 143a, even in the presence of HCl.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an improved process for deacylation and desulfurization of pyrazolotriazoles using hypophosphorous acid.
	• Pyrazolotriazoles are useful magenta couplers for photographic products.
	• The process involves reacting acylated compounds with hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric acid to reduce impurities.
• The use of hypophosphorous acid reduces the formation of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities.
	• The process results in higher product yield and purity compared to traditional methods.
	• The compounds used in the process have inert substituents that are stable and non-reactive.
• The reaction conditions include acylation, deacylation, and desulfurization steps conducted at specific temperatures and pressures.
	• The process can be conducted in the presence of a catalyst and is completed in a few hours.
	• The final product is isolated using extraction techniques and meets the desired purity criteria.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from different fiber types by sequentially taking partial quantities from fiber bales.
    * Known methods involve taking partial quantities from multiple fiber bales, leading to residual fibers and non-optimal homogeneity.
    * The new method involves measuring the entire quantity of each fiber bale before each pass and removing a calculated partial quantity from each bale.
    * The partial quantities are taken off in sequence in a predetermined number of passes, ensuring all fiber bales are opened without residuals.
    * A timing relay is used to ensure partial quantities are removed within a predetermined period, preventing delays and ensuring uniform delivery to processing machines.
    * The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device to control the operation based on measurements.

* The bale opener can be a plucker, stripper roll, spiked apron, or picker, with a height-measuring device for accurate determination of partial fiber quantities.
    * The control device includes a computer to determine precise partial quantities and control the fiber removal operation.
    * A pole-reversible electromotor accelerates the operation if needed, ensuring timely removal of partial quantities.
    * The method and apparatus allow for efficient and homogeneous mixing of fiber types for further processing.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is directed to method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns laid at angles of 30° to 150° to the long axis of the fabric.
	• Traditional fabric formation methods like knitting and weaving are not suitable for modern uses requiring structural strength.
		• Non-woven fabrics are developed for structural uses, involving layers held together by stitching, loose weave knitting, or adhesive bonding.
		• The invention allows for parallel courses of bias laid fabrics with controlled density and uniformity.
	• The apparatus includes conveyors with needles, yarn carriers, and rake systems to place yarns on the fabric.
		• Rake systems move to grasp yarns from carriers and place them on the needles of the conveyors.
		• Overlapping of yarns in successive courses can be controlled to adjust fabric density.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to weft insertion in a multiple-color air jet loom, providing a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads with appropriate weft carrying forces.
	• Prior looms used uniform air pressure for all weft threads, resulting in wasted air and varying speeds for different weft threads.
• The invention allows for different weft carrying forces by ejecting air at different pressures or for different intervals of time, ensuring stable insertion and preventing air wastage.
	• Different embodiments show variations in subnozzle arrangements, pressure regulation, and control systems for efficient weft insertion in air jet looms.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres, with a process involving health-preserving bast fibres and blended spinning with other fibres.
	* The process includes steps such as health preserving the fibres, opening, cleaning, and carding them, and spinning them into yarn.
* The process aims to reduce end breakage rates and improve flexibility and spinnability of bast fibres, resulting in higher work efficiency and product quality.
	* Experiments with different fibre combinations and preservation conditions show a decrease in end breakage rates, demonstrating the effectiveness of the process.
* The invention allows for variations and modifications within the scope of the disclosure, covering departures from the described embodiments within the limits of the appended claims.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides methods and apparatus for measuring and removing rotational variability from nip pressure profiles in nip presses.
	• The invention utilizes multiple sets of sensors strategically placed along the sensing roll to measure pressure at different cross-directional positions.
		• Sensors are spaced circumferentially apart to provide multiple pressure readings at each cross-directional position.
		• Averaging the readings from corresponding sensors helps to calculate a more accurate nip pressure profile.
• The system includes a transmitter unit on the sensing roll, a wireless receiver, and a processing unit to calculate and display the nip pressure profile.
	• Different configurations of sensors, such as 2, 3, or 4 sets spaced at 180°, 120°, or 90° circumferentially, can be used to reduce rotational variability and provide accurate pressure measurements.
		• The number of sensor sets needed depends on the frequency of rotational variability present in the roll.
		• Graphical displays show how different sensor configurations can reduce measurement errors and provide more accurate nip pressure profiles.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a combination electrical cord support and holder for an ironing board, supporting the cord of an electric iron and holding articles like spray starch or beverage containers.
	* The apparatus includes a clamp for securing to the ironing board, a flexible cord support for holding the electrical cord, and a detachable article holder.
* The cord support has a flexible mast with a foot for pivotable movement, while the article holder has a circular hoop with support bars and vertical supports for holding articles securely.
	* An extension portion on the clamp includes a female electrical outlet for plugging in the iron, providing convenience and organization during ironing tasks.
</summary>

<summary>
* Buttonhole controlling device for sewing machine
    * Prior art devices may not work well with different fabrics
    * Objective of invention is to create neat buttonholes regardless of fabric type
    * Device includes foot pad, travelling assembly, and adjustable stop
    * Travelling assembly moves with work during sewing
    * Adjustable stop allows operator to define closure point of buttonhole
    * Operator can adjust stop for perfect buttonhole in different materials
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid.
    * German Patent No. 830,040 discloses a technique of spraying a treatment solution onto a moving textile web.
    * An endless sieve belt is used to transport the textile web along a horizontal path.
    * A liquid applicator applies the liquid to the web, followed by a suction device to remove the liquid.
    * A dwell stretch device conducts the textile web in a spread-out condition through dwell loops.
    * The apparatus allows for a longer action time of the liquid on the substances to be removed from the fabric.
    * Effective washing is possible without soiling a white background, especially for printed materials.
    * Different embodiments of the apparatus include air passes or sieve drums for the dwell stretch.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a dry cleaning machine with an air flow system for bringing ambient air into the access opening whenever the door is opened.
    • The system is exclusive of the air recirculating system and reduces the exhausting of residual solvent vapors from the tubs.
    • A separate intake fan and duct are provided with a normally closed valve to isolate the intake system from solvent vapors during normal operation.
    • When the door is opened, the intake fan is energized and the valve is opened to draw air into the access opening and directly into the interposed duct.
• The machine includes a solvent flow system for filling, washing, draining, spinning, and tumble drying with heat.
    • The solvent is continuously filtered and recirculated during the fill and wash portion of the cycle.
    • During the drain and spin portion, the solvent is dumped back into the storage tank.
    • The air flow system is isolated from the solvent during the spin cycle to prevent streaks and swales in the clothes.
• The machine also features a solvent vapor handling system to retain vapors in an expandable bag for reclamation.
    • A safety release valve is included to prevent pressure buildup in the bag.
    • The refrigeration system is used to condense solvent vapors and maintain the solvent in the storage tank at a predetermined temperature.
    • The refrigeration system is controlled to cool two distinct evaporator coils under different demand conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention involves a method and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments using non-eductive drawing.
	• The system includes a quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the machine width for filament impingement.
• The system uses the same air for quenching and drawing the filaments, resulting in better control of cross-machine uniformity.
	• The slot opening size determines the drawing tension and filament denier, allowing for easy adjustments.
• The system minimizes turbulence and entanglement of filaments, leading to improved web formation uniformity.
	• The filaments are exposed to a high-speed air stream before landing on the collector belt, aiding in energy transfer and web formation control.
• The system is flexible and can accommodate a wide range of materials and operating conditions.
	• The method involves providing a thermoplastic polymer in fluid condition, spinning filaments through a spinneret, quenching the filaments, and forming a non-woven web on a collector belt.
• Test results show stable operation with varying parameters, producing fine continuous filaments suitable for various applications.
	• The system can be used to make nonwoven materials for sanitary products, garments, surgical drapes, industrial filtration, automotive carpet, and more.
</summary>

<summary>
• The first embodiment of the sewing machine includes receivers 94 and 95 to detect ultrasonic waves from an ultrasonic pen for specifying sewing positions on a work cloth.
    • The sewing machine calculates the specified coordinates based on the detection timings of the ultrasonic waves.
    • The user can easily set a sewing position by touching the work cloth with the ultrasonic pen.
    • The second embodiment involves attaching the embroidery unit to the sewing machine, with receivers 84 and 85 on the unit for detecting ultrasonic waves.
• The third embodiment eliminates the cable connection between the ultrasonic pen and the sewing machine by using an electromagnetic wave output circuit in the pen and an electromagnetic wave detector in the machine.
    • The machine identifies the transmission timing of the ultrasonic wave based on the detected electromagnetic wave signal.
    • The user can specify the sewing position without the obstruction of a cable.
• In the fourth embodiment, an additional receiver 96 is provided on the sewing machine, and the ultrasonic pen does not have an electromagnetic wave output circuit.
    • The machine calculates the specified coordinates based on the detection timings of all three receivers.
    • The user can specify the sewing position without the need for a cable connection.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to preparations for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials by using wool particles or bamboo powder as carriers for functional additives.
    • Wool particles are pulverized into ultrafine powder to carry functional additives for improved durability.
    • Bamboo powder is also pulverized into ultrafine powder for moisture management properties.
    • The preparations are applied to fabric materials using printing, padding, or foam application methods.
• The treated fabrics show enhanced ultraviolet protection, wicking properties, and wrinkle recovery.
    • Ultraviolet protection is improved even after multiple wash cycles.
    • Wicking properties are enhanced, allowing for quick absorption and drying.
    • Wrinkle recovery is significantly improved, even after multiple washes.
• The preparations also provide anti-bacterial properties to the fabrics.
    • Ultrafine zinc oxide and titanium dioxide carried by wool particles enhance anti-bacterial properties.
    • The fabrics show higher inhibition percentages of antimicrobial activities compared to untreated fabrics.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an automatic quilting machine for stitching patterns into large fabrics like bedspreads or quilts.
    • The machine includes a frame quilting table that can be moved in the X, Y, or X-Y direction by a process controller.
    • The sewing machine head is controlled by a separate computer, allowing for independent programming of stitching functions and table movements.

• The system includes a computer aided design program for creating and duplicating patterns on the fabric.
    • The program allows for hand-drawn patterns to be converted into machine-readable language.
    • The process controller can automatically sew the programmed pattern into the fabric and duplicate it at desired locations.

• By using separate computers for controlling the sewing machine and table movement, reprogramming is simplified.
    • Changes to the stitching functions or table movements can be made independently without reprogramming the entire system.
    • This segregation of control functions allows for more efficient and precise quilting operations.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method of making a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image.
    * Conventional textile fabric production involves multiple steps from carding to weaving.
    * Nonwoven fabrics are more efficient to produce directly from the carding process.
    * Hydroentangled fabrics have improved properties and durability.
    * Support layers like spunbond material are used to reinforce nonwoven fabrics.
    * Three-dimensional image transfer devices are used to enhance the appearance and physical properties of nonwoven fabrics.
* The method involves providing two precursor webs with different fibrous matrices and a support layer, then subjecting them to hydroentanglement on an imaging surface.
    * The support layer acts as a fiber distribution control layer to prevent excessive intermingling of the fibrous matrices.
    * The fabric can have apertures and different fiber compositions on each side.
    * The method is suitable for various applications like hygiene products, medical supplies, and cleaning wipes.
    * Post-entanglement treatments can be applied to further modify the fabric structure.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric.
	* The device includes a stop in the feed path of the strip that can be retracted after being contacted by the strip.
* The stop controls a signal transmitter for a setting means, such as an air cylinder, to adjust its position.
	* The stop is mounted on a two-armed lever that is biased by a spring.
* A control cam is used to actuate a proximity switch independently of the strip's motion.
	* The device ensures continuous operation and can sew relatively stiff strips of material.
* The strip of material is guided into a predetermined end position by the stop, which triggers the necessary switching processes to start the sewing operation.
	* The device is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture.
* The operation of the device involves the strip contacting the stop, triggering the retraction of the stop, and starting the sewing machine.
	* The device includes a sequence control to manage the sewing operation efficiently.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various garments.
	* Examples include the collar of a sweater, neck rope portion of a tanktop, lower end portion of baseball stockings, and a neck rope portion of an apron.
* Traditional methods involve sewing tape- or rope-shaped knit fabric to the garment, leading to increased thickness and decreased comfort.
	* Extra sewing processes reduce productivity and increase manufacturing costs.
* The new method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds.
	* The final course loops of both knit pieces are overlaid and gradually bound off to connect them.
* By repeating the process based on the width of the knit fabric, the end parts are joined securely without loosening stitches.
* The method involves transferring loops between needle beds, overlaying loops, and forming new loops to decrease the number of loops gradually.
* The process ensures a seamless connection between the two knit pieces, enhancing both appearance and comfort.
* The method can be applied to various garments and parts requiring linking of tape- or rope-shaped knit fabric.
* The flat knitting machine used can have multiple needle beds, with one or both being movable in different directions.
* The knit fabric can have different textures such as plain knitting, rib knitting, or tubular knitting.
* Computer-controlled transfers follow a designed knitting pattern to ensure accuracy and consistency.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a flexible traction element for lifts, made of stranded cables sheathed in a thermoplastic material.
    * The core strand of each stranded cable is sheathed with a flexible thermoplastic layer.
    * The stranded cables are coated with a thermoplastic material to increase flexibility and adhesion.
    * The production line includes an extruder with a thread guide and matrix for precise positioning of the stranded cables.
    * The method involves degreasing, preheating, and sheathing the stranded cables with the thermoplastic material to improve adhesion and flexibility.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine.
	* It aims to minimize hindrance to the guiding of the needle thread loop.
	* The arrangement includes cams and a spring rod to prevent rotation of the bobbin housing.
	* A capsule release device provides a rotational impulse to facilitate thread movement.

</summary>

<summary>
* Liquid silanes are used in the production of silicon-based nanowires and films.
    * Cyclohexasilane can be transformed into solid polydihydrosilane by thermal treatment or light activation.
    * Electrospinning is a continuous nanofabrication technique capable of producing nanowires of various materials.
    * The inks can be used with different deposition techniques and can be tailored for specific applications.
* Accelerants can be added to the inks to enhance polymerization and film formation.
    * Polyhydropolysilanes accelerate the polymerization of cyclohexasilane.
    * Different solid phases, such as metal particles or semiconducting materials, can be added to the inks.
* The transformed nanofibers can be coated with an electrically conductive material for use in composite materials.
    * Coherent, ion conductive coatings of carbon can be applied to the fibers.
    * The fibers can be used as components in various applications, such as electrode composites for lithium-ion batteries.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is directed to an arrangement for the control of thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders, each equipped with a brake rotor and braking element adjustable by a tensioning lever biased by the departing thread.
	* The braking force automatically decreases as the wind diameter of each spool is reduced, ensuring predetermined weight distribution on the tensioning lever and thread tension on the threads.
* Existing creel arrangements have electromagnetic brakes or pneumatic biasing arrangements for thread brakes, allowing for central control of tension but resulting in a loss of individual tension control.
	* Swiss Patent 358 043 describes a thread brake with a pneumatic cylinder piston assembly controlled from a central point.
	* British Patent 1 071 190 discloses a brake shoe forced against a rotating braking surface by pressure means.
* The present invention provides an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel with controllers settable by fluid pressure, each coupled to a spool holder with a brake rotor and adjustable braking element.
	* A tensioning lever biased by the departing thread occupies an angular position dependent on thread tension and weight, with a biasing arrangement activated by fluid pressure influencing the tensioning lever.
* The biasing arrangement is a piston/cylinder assembly connected to the tensioning lever, allowing for central control of thread tension in the entire creel.
	* The biasing arrangement operates without hindering the swinging action of the tensioning lever, ensuring equal force distribution in the control range.
* The tensioning lever can hold a brake shoe for additional braking effect, which is applied under higher fluid pressures for rapid braking action.
	* The braking rotor can be a brake drum with a braking band or a braking disc with a magnetic system for generating eddy currents and varying braking force.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides a sewing machine detector that detects the position of the sewing needle and the speed of the machine.
    • The detector includes light shielding discs mounted on a shaft, optical fiber supporters for fixing optical fibers, and reflecting portions for accurate signal detection.
    • Light is transmitted through the optical fibers to detect needle UP and DOWN positions, sewing machine speed, and thread trimmer timing position.

• The detector design reduces stress on optical fibers by supporting them linearly, eliminates the need for curved reflecting portions, and ensures accurate optical axes for stable operation.
    • The detector is durable against shaft vibration, less expensive to manufacture, and results in a thinner and more compact detecting section.
    • The power indicating optical fiber does not interfere with sewing machine control circuitry, simplifying construction and ensuring accurate signal transmission.

• The detector allows for simultaneous detection of multiple signals, easy assembly of accurate optical axes, and long-term maintenance of signal detection accuracy.
    • The design includes indicator arrows for angle adjustment, different colored markings for differentiation, and projections for manual rotation of the light shielding discs.
    • The detector can detect additional signals beyond needle position and speed, providing versatility in sewing machine control. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
	* The process involves completing coagulation and washing the yarn with water of non-alkaline pH to reduce sulphur and improve whiteness.
* The process results in a yarn with a high degree of whiteness without the need for additional treatments, using simple and economical means.
	* The yarn is treated with specific water conditions and undergoes specific processing stages to achieve the desired whiteness.
* The process is faster and more cost-effective compared to traditional methods, reducing the number of treatment liquors and simplifying the production process.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention addresses the issue of washing pulp after oxygen bleaching, which causes foam and reduces vacuum in the washer.
    * Previous methods for deaerating pulp before washing involved expensive equipment like the Deculator process or large degassing chambers.
    * The inventors developed a small deaeration tank with no moving parts, designed to be placed on top of the oxygen reactor.
    * The tank includes an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a swirl inducing inlet pipe for optimal deaeration.
* The oxygen process involves pumping pulp through a series of steam mixers and oxygen mixers before entering the deaeration tank.
    * The height of the pulp in the tank is controlled by a sensor, which regulates the flow to the washer.
    * Filtrate from the washer is used as the swirling fluid in the deaeration tank to maintain a pumpable consistency.
* The deaeration tank is a cylindrical closed tank with specific dimensions for optimal deaeration.
    * The inlet pipe allows pulp to splash against the tank wall, while the outlet is sized to handle the pulp flow.
    * Filtrate enters the tank through a swirl inducing inlet at a specific velocity to aid in deaeration.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.
	• The BTR composite structures consist of stuffer members, tendon elements, and panels bonded to the ends of the stuffer members.
• The design process involves function-oriented material design (FOMD) using topology optimization to optimize the out-plane stiffness of the composite material.
	• The composite structure includes tendons, ribs, joints, flesh, skins, and shell components for improved structural performance.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames in structures to dissipate energy during dynamic events.
	• The device may plastically deform to limit loads and can be easily replaced after deformation.
		• The device is connected to the brace in the braced frame structure.
		• It can withstand high lateral loads and dissipate energy during dynamic events.
		• The device may have different geometries to accommodate various bracing configurations.
	• An indicator means may be used to detect plastic deformation after a dynamic event.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a unit type bedroom cabinet designed for flophouse facilities in existing buildings.
	* The bedroom cabinet is constructed with an outer casing and an inner casing, allowing for the accommodation of devices and shelves without protruding from the cabinet.
* A second embodiment of the bedroom cabinet includes spacer members with vent grooves to provide ventilation and sound-proofing throughout the entire cabinet.
	* The spacer members vary in strength based on their location within the cabinet, ensuring structural integrity and functionality.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a portable guard rail support for construction sites.
	• It provides a safe work area for workers at dangerous heights.
		• Guard rail support includes a base plate, upright column, rail brackets, kick board flange, brace, and safety tie-off ring.
		• A concrete-filled steel base is also provided for stability when anchoring is not possible.
		• A safety barrier can be constructed using multiple guard rail supports with wooden rails and kick boards.
		• An alternative mesh-like fence structure can also be used with the guard rail supports.
		• Installation and removal of the guard rail assembly is efficient and can be done by a single worker.
		• The guard rail support prevents damage to lumber and ensures durability for repeated use.
		• The system meets safety regulations for rail height, spacing, and load capacity.
		• The invention can be used in various construction environments beyond just building sites.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to the stimulation of crude oil reservoirs using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods to enhance production.
	* The method involves generating acoustic and electromagnetic-acoustic vibrations to stimulate oil flow in reservoirs.
* The recovered fluids from the wellbore can be separated into components such as hydrocarbons, gases, water, and impurities using various separation methods.
	* Separation methods include membrane processes, fractionation, cryogenic separation, solvent extraction, and cryogenic separation combined with solvent extraction.
</summary>

<summary>
* The splice described in the document is used to extend the length of a soil reinforcing element by coupling it with a grid-strip.
	* The splice includes wave plates with transverse protrusions to receive transverse wires from the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip.
	* Connective devices secure the splice by coupling the wave plates together and preventing the transverse wires from escaping.
* Multiple splices and grid-strips can be used to extend the length of a single soil reinforcing element to achieve the desired reinforcing distance from the vertical facing.
	* The transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip are clamped down by tightening nuts onto bolts to prevent lateral movement.
	* The splice can be customized with different numbers of transverse protrusions and connective devices to accommodate various soil reinforcing element lengths.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a novel design for a plow blade with a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, produced with basic manufacturing processes allowing efficient production.
    * The blade construction includes a multiple component assembly, providing the ability to rebuild a blade, replacing worn portions.
    * Another aspect involves a process of ejecting specific fluid at specific points along the plow blade to maximize desirable characteristics while minimizing the volume of ejected fluid.
    * The design allows for tailoring fluid injection characteristics to match specific job requirements.
* Various embodiments provide a plow that can be easily modified using hand tools without welding, allowing for control of flow rates and location of fluid injection.
    * Components are manufactured with traditional processes, defining flow paths by stacking leading edge sections with flow voids and attaching them to a blade.
    * The configurations provide appropriate function and easily tailored characteristics to match specific job requirements.
    * The invention allows for modifications and variations within the scope of the appended claims.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a building system for stucco type cavity wall construction techniques.
    • The system allows for panels greater than 2.4 meters in height and 4 meters in width without movement joints.
    • Panels are created in situ with a plaster matrix applied in multiple layers.
    • Components include battens, mesh reinforcement, and proprietary plaster mixes.
• The system includes components such as bottom members, head flashings, jam flashings, and movement control joint extrusions.
    • These components are made of uPVC and provide moisture drainage and protection.
    • Mesh sheets are used as inner reinforcement and fibreglass mesh for additional reinforcement.
    • Vertical and horizontal movement control joints are provided to accommodate building movement.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to safes for valuable papers and articles, with prior art including wall and floor safes embedded in concrete or free-standing.
    * Early safe structures include a burglar-proof safe with a laminated door, a wall safe with lateral recesses for a separate door, and a tamper-proof cabinet with a sliding door.
    * The present invention provides a safe with grooves for a steel door, lock assembly with reinforcing bolts, and a simple yet secure door locking mechanism.
* The safe construction includes a liner with grooves for door placement, lock notches for engagement, and safety bolts for protection against lateral forces.
    * An alternate embodiment features a liner with fins for structural integrity, a lock notch for engagement, and a bar member for shear strength at the locking location.
    * The door is inserted and removed by sliding into the grooves, providing a secure locking mechanism to protect against prying attempts.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to monitoring fluid pressures in geological formations.
	• Traditional piezometers involve open tube standpipes in boreholes.
		• Fluid levels are measured manually or with pressure transducers.
		• Standpipes can dampen true pressures of the formation.
	• Low volume pressure transducers were developed to overcome volumetric issues.
		• Pneumatic piezometers and vibrating wire transducers were used.
		• Pressure transducers were later cemented directly into boreholes.
• The invention aims to isolate pressure sensors in boreholes to measure accurate fluid pressures.
	• A staged process involving fluid injection is used to clear filters and displace grout.
		• A final stage involves hydrofracturing the formation to measure pressures.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function and a method of mounting an elastic member.
	* Mainly used in new transit systems, monorails, road bridges, footbridges, etc.
* Existing rubber and steel expansion joints have issues with slip resistance, durability, and level management.
	* Rubber joints lack durability for tire support, steel joints have level management challenges.
* The invention provides a jointing structure with elastic members and a joint block to prevent tire fall-in and improve safety.
	* Elastic members are made of laminated rubber and mounted inside steps with a joint block across the expansion gap.
* The structure allows for smooth vehicle traveling, absorbs bridge girder expansion/contraction, and prevents tire fall-in.
	* Joint block, supporting blocks, and intermediate joint blocks are made of concrete for durability.
* The method of mounting the elastic member involves joining them across the expansion gap and fixing them to the steps.
	* Deformation of the elastic members allows for absorption of bridge girder expansion/contraction.
* Different embodiments show variations in the arrangement of the joint block and supporting blocks to reduce tire fall-in.
	* Oblique expansion gaps, symmetrical expansion gaps, and multiple joint blocks are used for different scenarios.
* The invention ensures high slip resistance, reduces tire fall-in, and allows for easy maintenance of the jointing structure.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an enclosed floor track system for transporting wheeled hand trucks in a fluid treatment chamber without contaminating the environment.
	* The system prevents brine solution from coming into contact with the hand truck wheels, maintaining the sanitary condition of the chamber.
	* Two embodiments of the system are described, one for horizontally axled hand trucks and another for hand trucks with downwardly depending struts.
* The system includes a wheel channel with support legs, sidewalls, and a cover plate to prevent brine solution from entering the wheel channel.
	* The cover plate can be pivoted for easy cleaning of the channel.
	* In the second embodiment, inflatable elastomer seals are used to enclose the wheel channel and prevent brine solution from entering.
* The system allows for the recovery and reuse of the brine solution, preserving natural resources and providing an economic advantage.
	* The system is designed to drain washing fluids into a waste sewer and prevent contamination of the brine solution.
	* The enclosed floor track system is constructed of stainless steel to resist corrosive attack by the brine solution.
</summary>

<summary>
* The lock device prevents a work machine from tilting due to its weight, specifically preventing a backhoe boom from rotating downward.
	* The lock device consists of an engaging member on the boom or boom bracket and an engaged member on the other.
* The engaging member is a plate with a hook part and a slot, supported by a support pin and guide member.
	* The lock plate can be easily moved to lock or release positions by sliding along the slot and touching the guide member.
* The guide member on the boom ensures the lock plate stays in place regardless of the boom's position.
	* The lock plate can be operated manually using an operation lever attached to it.
* The lock pin is engaged with the lock plate to secure the boom in place, preventing unexpected movement during travel or storage.
	* The lock plate can be easily assembled and prevented from slipping off using a slip-prevention plate on the support pin.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with an adjustable central vacuum portion for regulating suction efficiency.
	• The device overcomes the drawback of prior art devices by providing an adjustment mechanism on the vacuum head itself.
• Adjustment mechanisms on the top of the suction head regulate the spacing between the suction portion and the pool bottom.
	• This allows for real-time adjustment of suction without needing to adjust the suction source.
• The device includes outboard and inboard roller assemblies for maintaining the platform at a specific distance from the pool bottom.
	• The inboard roller assemblies have a specially configured frame member for adjusting the spacing between the central suction portion and the pool bottom.
• The adjustment mechanism includes connector means and wing nuts for vertically adjusting the axles of the inboard roller assemblies.
	• A coil spring is used to yieldably resist downward movement of the frame member.
• The device can be provided in kit form for retrofitting existing pool cleaning devices with minimal modification.
	• The kit includes frames, elongated connectors, wing nuts, coil springs, and axles for easy assembly.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from oil well drilling tools.
	* Wear bushings protect against wear in casing heads and other well head elements.
* The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel, upper and lower collar sections, and a retriever section.
	* The retriever section has protruding members for engaging with a wear bushing and can move vertically but not rotate.
* The apparatus allows for easy retrieval of wear bushings without removing the drill bit.
	* It can be threadably engaged between two sections of drill pipe.
* An alternative embodiment includes a retriever section with a threaded end for engaging with threaded wear bushings.
	* This allows for retrieval of a specific type of wear bushing without removing the drill bit.
</summary>

<summary>
• A vibratory tool for downhole use allows wireline or other tools to pass through a central passage that can be closed by landing a plug on a seat.
	• The dump valve is annularly disposed around the central passage to prevent slamming against a seat during cycling.
• Stacked pistons in the tool increase power delivery by increasing the piston area exposed to pressure.
	• The tool can be operated with or without impacts on each cycle, depending on the applied overpull force.
• The tool design eliminates the need for a dart assembly and allows for longer trouble-free service with fewer moving parts.
	• The modular design of the tool allows for customization based on the required power for specific downhole conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to a precast concrete retaining wall system for use alongside highways and railways.
    • Conventional retaining walls use various methods to oppose the moment force, such as gravity walls, piling walls, mechanically stabilized earth walls, cantilever walls, or anchored walls.
    • The present invention allows for taller walls and shorter bases by pre-manufacturing parts of the wall for assembly on-site.
    • The connection between the face panel and base is made by inserting rebar ends into openings in the base and sealing the connection with grout.
    • Additional stability measures, such as H-piles driven into the ground or a cast-in-place impact barrier, can be incorporated into the design.
• The retaining wall system includes precast face panels with integral counterforts and solid rectangular or trapezoidal bases.
    • Drainage openings are included in the counterforts for proper drainage behind the wall.
    • The connection between the face panel and base is reinforced with rebar and grout, eliminating the need for temporary shoring during installation.
    • Flexibility is provided for custom sizes and configurations, allowing for easy assembly and backfilling behind the wall.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of a producing oil or gas well for improving production therefrom.
    • Free-flowing oil is increasingly difficult to find, even in oil wells that once had very good flow.
    • Existing down hole heating systems lack efficacy and long-term reliability.

• The present invention addresses shortcomings in conventional approaches to heating oil and paraffin down hole by focusing heat where it needs to be and protecting electrical components from chemical or physical attack.
    • Existing down hole heaters fail due to lack of protection for heating elements and electrical connections.
    • The present design focuses heat in the production zone and prevents heat loss from up hole components.

• The down hole heating system of the present invention includes a heating unit with electrical resistance type heater rods, heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, and stainless steel collars to contain and focus heat in the production zone.
    • The system prevents electrical problems by shielding electrical connections and ensuring reliable power delivery.
    • The method for using the system involves heat treating an oil or gas well to improve flow rates, with the option to use cable instead of down hole pipe for supporting the heating unit during maintenance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to down hole tools for installing and removing objects in wells, including stuck or lost objects.
	* Specifically improves connection of a pull tool to a down hole object and disconnection if needed.
* Objects, known as "fish," can become lost or stuck in a well bore during drilling or servicing operations.
	* Various tools like pull tools, grap pling devices, and spears are used for fishing operations.
* API Standard fishing necks are used for connection, but can become corroded or eroded, making disconnection difficult.
	* Overshot type grappling devices are used for connection, but disconnection can be challenging.
* Mechanical shocks are sometimes used for disconnection, but can cause equipment failure or wear.
	* The invention provides a mechanism for easy interconnection and disconnection of down hole objects.
* The mechanism can be an external overshot or an internal spear, both with inner and outer body structures.
	* Telescoping movement of the bodies allows for selective gripping of objects to be removed from the well bore.
* A controllable locking mechanism with guide pins and spring elements enables controlled latching and unlatching of the pulling tool.
	* This allows for efficient removal of objects without the need for jarring or mechanical vibration.
</summary>

<summary>
• Example embodiment relates to modular composed stave floors
	• Drawbacks of conventional stave floors include thin sight substrate thickness leading to deformation and detachment
	• Example embodiment provides method for manufacturing stave floors with thicker sight substrate and multidirectional holding means for increased durability
</summary>

<summary>
* Ladder attachments are designed to prevent the ladder from defacing the work surface and slipping or sliding.
	* Ladders are commonly used for tasks like painting or cleaning, but can cause instability and damage to the work surface.
	* The large contact area braces increase stability and prevent defacing of the work surface.
* The brace assembly includes an arm with a flange, U-bolt, and resilient pad assembly.
	* The U-bolt secures the flange to the ladder rung, while the clamp provides additional stability.
	* The resilient pad assembly can pivot horizontally to allow the ladder to straddle corners.
* The brace assembly is easy to install and can be adjusted to fit different sizes of ladders.
	* The construction of the brace assembly may vary based on the length of the arm and material of the ladder.
	* The attachment improves lateral stability, increases contact area with the work surface, and prevents damage to the surface.
* The invention allows for modifications and applications to adapt to different situations without departing from the essence of the invention.
	* The claims cover all modifications and applications that align with the true spirit and scope of the invention.
	* The invention provides a solution to common ladder problems and enhances safety and efficiency during use.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool.
    • Fast-acting fastener driving tools are widely used in the construction industry.
    • Presently known collated nails are assembled using tape strips or an extruded plastic material.
    • The plastic material in the plastic-formed strips adheres to the fasteners, reducing debris generation.
    • The collation system includes a collar portion that captures the fastener shank and a connecting portion between adjacent collars.
• The fastener assembly includes a row of fasteners arranged parallel to each other, with the plastic material molded onto and adhered to the fasteners.
    • The plastic material is an adhesive polymer, such as a polyolefin blend, and is preheated prior to molding onto the fasteners.
    • The connecting portion can be formed with a bridge and rib, with a preferentially weakened region to influence separation at a desired location.
    • Various configurations, such as tapered collars, embossed patterns, and eccentric nail placements, are used to enhance the performance of the collated nail strip.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants in artifacts or machines like automobiles, trains, ships, and aircraft.
  • It is useful in industries such as aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
• The nozzle has a bell-shaped lower section and an injection button for precise sealant application.
  • It can be used with manual cartridges or automated injection machines.
• The injection button has channels and orifices for accurate sealant dispersion.
  • It allows for sealing operations around rivets and nuts with precision.
• The design of the nozzle improves encapsulation and sealing of rivets and nuts.
  • It can be used in various industries including aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
• The nozzle is made of plastic, preferably polypropylene, for ease of use and cleaning.
  • It simplifies the sealing work, reduces application time, and increases the quality of sealant application.
• The nozzle can be used manually or with extrusion guns for efficient sealant application.
  • It provides a perfect seal from air and oxidizing liquids, crucial for the longevity of machines.
• After sealing operations, the nozzle can be modified for applying sealing cords or filler sealants.
