  • This simplifies the sealing process, saves time and labor, and ensures a more economical and high-quality sealant application.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a position sensor signal conditioner and monitoring system for multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires.
    * The sensor includes a waveform generator and error correction generator to modify the sensing signal and provide a conditioned signal.
        * The waveform generator receives the unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer and modifies it in response to an error correction signal.
        * The error correction generator includes a comparator, controller, and signal processor to provide the error correction signal.
    * The sensor monitoring system is remotely located and provides power to the sensor and receives the conditioned sensing signal via two wires.
* The sensor eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not provide information about the object's position.
    * A closed-loop compensation circuit constantly compares the sensor output to a desired minimum value and generates a correction signal.
    * The sensor output is compared in both slow and fast movement scenarios to ensure accurate position signal delivery.
* The sensor includes a window reference circuit to adjust the conditioned sensor signal output if it exceeds preset high or low reference signals.
    * The signal processor generates small and large reference signals to eliminate drift and allow rapid recalibration.
    * The DAC and counter combination provides enough resolution to ensure the error correction signal is not a significant portion of the sensor output.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust functions in internal combustion engines.
	* Valve timing is critical for engine performance, with traditional cam/spring systems limiting speed and efficiency.
* The invention eliminates the need for springs, allowing for higher engine speeds and more efficient power delivery.
	* A variable valve actuation system allows for precise control of valve port opening and closing.
* Computer control can optimize valve operation for different driving conditions, improving fuel economy.
	* The system includes a rotating cam and translating means to control valve position.
* The system can be applied to engines with multiple valves per cylinder, offering increased performance and efficiency.
	* The invention simplifies valve control, improves engine performance, and reduces gas consumption.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs.
  • Basic aquariums need additional features like filtration, lighting, and temperature control for aquatic organisms.
• A light member includes a housing with a lighting control region for white and blue light.
  • The control channels can be controlled independently with switches.
  • Modules with LEDs emitting white or blue light can be added to the lighting control region.
• Modules can have different LED configurations, sizes, and shapes.
  • Some modules include RF communication for remote control.
  • In-line timers can be used to control the color and intensity of the light.
• The light member can be used under cabinets with a bracket and can be linked together in a series.
  • Optics elements can be added to the light member for different lighting effects.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures.
  * Current flow deflection apparatuses, like stator or rotor blades in a gas turbine, use internal cooling channels to reduce metal temperatures.
* The invention introduces separate inserts for separating walls in the flow deflection apparatus, replacing the need for cast separating walls.
  * Inserts are made of metal or non-metal materials and offer advantages like reduced weight, simplified production, and adjustable cooling systems.
* The flow deflection apparatus can be a hollow casting with holders for inserting separating walls, which can be connected securely to the apparatus.
  * Cooling fluid flows in opposite directions in adjacent channels, deflected by U-shaped separating walls.
* The invention is particularly beneficial for gas turbine blades, simplifying their geometry and reducing centrifugal-force stresses.
</summary>

<summary>
• System and method for controlling fuel delivery system for vehicles
  • Can switch between automatic and manual control smoothly
  • Provides full operation of the vehicle under manual control
• Control unit processes signals to set throttle position for optimum performance
  • Can be used with continuously variable transmission for optimal control
• Subroutines for generating pulses for stepper motor and switching between control modes
  • Logic sequencer and phase drivers used for stepper motor control
</summary>

<summary>
• Waste fuel burner designed to emit minimal particulate materials and operate efficiently
	• Utilizes conical pile of waste fuel with preheated underfire air for gasification
		• Primary combustion chamber maintains low temperature to prevent slag formation
		• Secondary combustion chamber ensures complete combustion with excess air
• Control system adjusts air and wood feed rates based on BTU demand
	• Swirl air and secondary air quantities trimmed based on temperature and oxygen levels
		• Swirl air reduced to lower primary chamber exit temperature, increased secondary air maintains separation of particulate
		• Secondary air adjusted to maintain outlet temperatures for long refractory life
</summary>

<summary>
* Evaporative air conditioners operate by cooling the air of an enclosure while maintaining or reducing its moisture content.
	* Early coolers increased moisture levels in the air, but subsequent designs focus on cooling the air without adding water vapor.
	* The present invention provides a highly efficient apparatus for cooling air by using a heat exchanger to separate evaporating water from the useful air.
		* The working air is recirculated from the load to the wet side of the heat exchanger for maximum efficiency.
		* Specific construction details, such as using an array of spaced vertically directed hollow elongated tubular members, contribute to the efficiency of the cooling system.
* A hybrid system is also described, where a portion of the cooled air stream is further cooled by heat exchange with the evaporator of a vapor compression refrigeration unit.
	* Only a minor portion of the cooled air stream is dehumidified by passing it over the evaporator coil to achieve a greater reduction in dry bulb temperature.
	* The condenser coil of the vapor compression refrigeration unit is placed in the discharge path of the wet side of the heat exchanger to increase energy efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
* The fluid pump comprises two or more pump heads in series to pump fluid from a reservoir.
  * Each pump head has an impeller driven by a common drive structure.
  * Fluid flows through conduits in each pump head and is combined into a single flow before exiting.
* The pump heads are connected by a biconical tubular connector to drive the impellers.
  * The connector prevents fluid from entering the drive train.
  * The pump can be mounted on a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer for operation.
* A pump assembly may include the fluid pump mounted on a support structure.
  * The support structure can be a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer.
  * The pump can be used to pump fluid from a reservoir to a holding tank or other apparatus.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders.
	• Traditional engine brake systems typically include one brake per cylinder, but having excess components can reduce engine robustness.
		• The present invention provides an engine with brakes for only a portion of the cylinders.
		• Each brake is connected to a cam actuated exhaust valve for operation during braking mode.
• The engine brake system includes a high pressure pump, electronic control module, and hydraulic system for controlling the brakes.
	• Each brake consists of a solenoid, valve member, spool valve, and piston for actuating the exhaust valve during engine braking.
		• The solenoid controls the flow of high and low pressure fluid to activate the brake.
		• The piston moves to open the exhaust valve when the brake is activated, allowing for engine braking.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure like an auxiliary gearbox.
   • Aircraft gas turbine gearboxes must withstand various loads, including extreme shocks from blade-off events.
   • Conventional gearboxes are rigid to withstand extreme loads, requiring additional material and weight.
• The link assembly includes a male link, a female link, and a pin to allow translation and dampen motion.
   • The female link receives the male link and forms a radial interface for damping.
   • The pin selectively retains the male and female links.
• The gearbox assembly includes the gearbox and the link assembly to couple the engine and gearbox.
   • The link assembly allows translation and dampens motion between the engine and gearbox.
   • The pin selectively retains the male and female links.
• The pin serves as a fusible link that shears under extreme loads to allow relative translation.
   • The radial interface between the male and female links provides coulomb damping.
   • The snap ring limits the travel of the male link within the female link.
• The use of the pin and coulomb damping eliminates the need for all linkages to withstand extreme loads.
   • Maintenance can replace the sheared pin following any shock event.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and balancing arrow shafts.
	* The invention includes a point cap system with adjustable weight for perfect balance and a balance pin for balancing arrow shafts.
* The invention also provides means for attaching points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter, utilizing external threads for reduced stress on graphite shafts.
	* Additionally, the invention includes point adaptors and nock caps for attaching arrow points and nocks, as well as a balance pin for adjusting point weight.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for small arms training.
    • It provides a cost-effective way to simulate small arms fire without modifying the weapon.
    • The simulator uses a plastic expendable housing metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic and an electrical ignition system.
    • The device produces sound and flash by igniting the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion through the weapon's ejection port.
    • The circuitry includes various functional blocks like bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillators, firing counter, firing decoder, firing control, firing sensors, and MILES interface.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that improves engine performance by utilizing dynamic effects of air flow and reduces noise from the air intake.
	• The device includes a tank, two pipes interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage at different locations, a valve in one of the pipes, and a valve actuating means responsive to engine operating conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a two-part bracket for mounting speakers or equipment to poles, flat surfaces, or other structures.
	• It allows for simple mounting of equipment by connecting the two parts of the bracket together.
• The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket for mounting objects on various surfaces.
	• Tapered springs guide the two brackets together during initial mating, and tabs and hooks secure them in place without tools.
• The system is designed for one person to install heavy items easily and efficiently.
	• Stainless steel components are used for weather, wind, and vibration resistance.
• For pole mounting, the assembly includes pole clamp components for secure attachment to poles of various sizes.
	• Chain, hooks, and wing nuts provide 360 degrees of horizontal adjustment and prevent rotation or slippage.
• A speaker mounting bracket can be attached to the adjustable bracket for mounting speakers using the assembly.
	• The speaker mounting bracket is securely screwed to the adjustable bracket, and the speaker is mounted on it for easy installation on a pole or surface.
</summary>

<summary>
• The disclosed concepts provide an efficient, clean burning burner and a system for attaching heat utilizing appliances.
	• The burner includes a combustion chamber with a fuel holder, secondary combustion support, and a shroud for tertiary combustion air.
• The burner features legs for support, a pivotally coupled ash pan, a perforate food grate, a cover, and manual couplings for modular heat utilizing appliances.
</summary>

<summary>
* Rotary internal combustion engines require efficient cooling systems to improve fuel economy and durability.
  * Uneven heating in the combustion chamber can lead to housing distortion and thermal fatigue.
  * In-line spark plug arrangements disrupt cooling flow, leading to overheating and structural failures.

* The invention aims to improve combustion efficiency and cooling characteristics in rotary engines.
  * Staggered spark plug boss arrangement promotes high velocity flow and prevents vapor collection.
  * Controlled flow regime between bosses increases heat transfer coefficient by up to 44%.

* Tests show that staggered spark plug configuration increases heat transfer rate and maintains uniform temperature gradient.
  * Offset of spark plug terminals is crucial for achieving benefits of the invention.
  * Improved cooling system design minimizes thermal distortion and structural failures in rotary engines.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.
	* The method uses control valve positions as feedback to maintain total mass flow through parallel valves constant.
* The flow compensation is determined based on the difference in flow characteristics between N and N-1 turbine control valves.
	* This compensation minimizes steam boiler pressure changes and turbine power changes during valve testing.
* The control system includes a test compensation circuit that adjusts flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance.
	* The compensation circuit uses a lookup table and mathematical calculations to determine the required flow compensation for valves not under test.
* Testing of the method and system showed a 95% reduction in pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main steam pressure.
	* The control system with flow compensation significantly improved performance compared to a system without flow compensation.
</summary>

<summary>
* Mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture
    * Specifically designed for aircraft cleaning apparatus
    * Outlet mixture ranges from 0% to 100% of each fluid
    * Various valve configurations used in cleaning apparatuses
    * Commercial airline industry requires stand-alone cleaning apparatus
* Valve body with first and second inlet passages and outlet passage
    * Adjustable valve directs fluids towards outlet passage
    * Mixture ranges from 0% to 100% of each fluid
    * Detailed description of valve components and operation
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline in permanent frost areas.
    • Method involves compressing gas to a higher pressure, cooling it, and feeding it back to the pipeline with a lower exit temperature and increased pressure.
    • Conventional methods use re-cooling plants with propane as a cooling agent during warm weather periods.
    • The present invention proposes a method where gas is compressed to an excess pressure, cooled, and then expanded to the desired exit pressure.
    • The method involves three compression stages, with two primary stages and an additional compression stage with booster compressors.
    • During winter operation, the compressor station operates differently, with valves switched for parallel operation of compressors.
    • The method reduces investment costs, increases plant availability, and reduces the risk of accidents compared to conventional re-cooling technology.
</summary>

<summary>
• Electronic components produce heat during operation
    • Free convection cooling may not be sufficient in many applications
    • Electric fans are used to move air for cooling
    • Traditional fastening methods for mounting fans increase costs
    • New system eliminates traditional fasteners for fan mounting

    • Cooling fan assembly includes motor, fan blade, and motor carrier
        • Motor rotates fan blade to move warm air out of enclosure
        • Motor carrier has mounting legs with resilient leg portions
        • Panel has recess portions with openings for mounting legs
        • Spring members on motor carrier prevent movement during operation

    • Installation process involves compressive and rotating forces
        • Load position: fan assembly rests against panel
        • Partially installed position: compressive force compresses spring members
        • Fully installed position: resilient leg portions captured in residual openings
        • Spring member remains compressed to prevent vibration and backing out
</summary>

<summary>
* Kinematic mounts are used in spacecraft structures to support instruments.
	* Lightweight composite materials used in spacecraft structures lack inherent damping.
		* This can lead to high vibration levels that compromise instrument functionality.
		* Existing kinematic mounts have limited success in reducing vibration.
	* The present invention introduces novel damping features to kinematic mounts.
		* Damping mechanisms are incorporated into the mounts to dissipate vibration energy.
		* The design uses six identical strut elements to reduce manufacturing complexity.
	* Two embodiments of damping designs are presented using spherical and slot dampers.
		* Spherical dampers induce shearing deformation in viscoelastic material.
		* Slot dampers induce compression/tension in viscoelastic material.
	* The damping mechanisms significantly increase damping in the mounts.
		* Modal vibration tests show damping values from 5-17% of critical damping.
		* Damped mounts reduce vibration loads on instruments during flight.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a clutch unit for large power transmission requirements in aircraft catapult systems.
	* Utilizes hydraulic fluid for retracting the clutch plates to reduce residual drag and as a coolant for the clutch discs.
* Features separate piston and cylinder means for each clutch disc segment to minimize residual drag.
	* Allows for easy replacement of clutch disc segments without disassembling the entire unit.
* The system includes a servo control valve, first and second stage fluid amplifiers, and the clutch unit.
	* Provides accurate fluid pressure control for torque output profiling in response to various conditions.
* The clutch unit design includes interleaved clutch plates and discs with segmental disc arrangement for improved cooling and torque control.
	* Retraction of the discs is achieved through centrifugal force of the oil, eliminating the need for retraction springs.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention involves a system with combustion cylinders and expansion cylinders to capture heat energy and reduce exhaust temperature.
  * Water injection is used to expand gases and create steam for additional drive.
  * Multiple expansion cylinders are used to lower exhaust temperature and potentially eliminate the need for a radiator.
* Catalytic materials can be used on surfaces exposed to hot exhaust gases to achieve catalytic conversion within the engine.
  * Different surface materials may be required to optimize catalytic reactions due to lower exhaust temperatures.
* A water recovery system is implemented to recycle water used for injection and cooling, reducing the need for a large water tank.
  * Water is recovered from the expansion cylinders and returned to a water tank for reuse.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention concerns the fabrication of plates or blanks of coated steel for welding and heat treatment to obtain parts with good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance.
	* Some applications require steel parts with high mechanical strength, impact resistance, and corrosion resistance, such as in the automotive industry.
* The method involves removing the metal alloy layer from the periphery of the plate before welding to prevent the formation of intermetallic areas that reduce deformability.
	* The removal can be done by brushing or laser ablation, ensuring good corrosion resistance and mechanical properties after heat treatment.
* The welded blanks are heated for alloying and austenizing, then hot-deformed to obtain parts with martensitic microstructure and high tensile strength.
	* The method results in parts with good ductility, corrosion resistance, and mechanical properties suitable for automotive safety components.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present application is a continuation of U.S. patent application Ser. No. 11/942,576, filed Nov. 19, 2007, entitled, “Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition System for Energy Extracting Vessel Navigation,” the contents of which is hereby incorporated by reference in its entirety.
    • Field of the Invention
        • Supervisory control and data acquisition systems
        • Remote control system for operation and navigation of a mobile structure for energy recovery from an offshore marine environment
        • Limitations of existing wind and hydrokinetic energy systems
        • Need for a novel SCADA system for remote control of mobile structures in high-energy environments
    • Description of the Related Art
        • Existing systems for recovery of wind and water energy are mostly stationary
        • Hydrokinetic turbine systems affixed to sailing vessels face limitations due to drag
        • Need for a remote control system for mobile structures to extract energy from hazardous environments
        • Previous patent applications do not fully address unmanned operation in high-energy environments
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage made from at least one ring element and multiple guide structures for rolling bodies.
  * The cage is produced by joining flat material ring segments in succession and welding them together.
* This method reduces cutting waste and production costs for rolling body guide cages.
  * It is particularly beneficial for cages with an internal diameter over 140 mm.
* The flat material ring segments are welded along edge regions in engagement zones to form the ring element.
  * Joint contours in the engagement zones provide a secure connection with minimal weld seam length.
* The ring segments are punched out from sheet metal material and formed as 120° segments.
  * Only three weld points are needed to join the segments together.
* The method is suitable for radial and axial bearing cages, such as groove and angular ball bearings.
  * Mirror-symmetry ring elements can be joined with offset weld points.
* Laser welding is preferred for forming the weld points, ensuring high-strength connections with minimal distortion.
  * Material bead formations can be used to provide additional material for welding.
</summary>

<summary>
* Methods and systems are provided for obtaining information related to a customer service location, including obtaining coordinates through a GPS system and updating databases with the coordinates.
* Another aspect involves generating directions for a service technician traveling between customer service locations, using a mapping system to provide driving directions based on latitude and longitude coordinates.
</summary>

<summary>
* The system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields consists of two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit.
  * The control unit processes the output signals of the sensors to create virtual sensor signals that represent the amplitude of the interfering field at the location of the object to be protected.
  * Independent control loops then modify the virtual sensor signals and generate control signals for the coils to compensate for the interfering fields.

* In cases where two compensation systems are operated directly beside each other, feedback effects between the systems are accounted for using a feedback matrix C.
  * The feedback matrix C is determined experimentally by measuring the components absorbed by the sensors of the second system when a signal is applied to the output of the first system.
  * This feedback matrix helps in eliminating interferences and optimizing the compensation of electromagnetic fields in dual system setups.

* The system allows for the compensation of both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields, providing protection against various types of interfering fields.
  * By using multiple sensors and control loops, the system can adapt to different interference scenarios and generate appropriate compensation fields.
  * The flexibility of the system allows for efficient and effective compensation of electromagnetic fields in diverse applications.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample using CARS microscopy, where a resonance signal is generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering.
	• The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site by a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.
• Bioorthogonal reactions are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without interfering with natural processes.
	• Typical bioorthogonal reactions include 1,3-dipolar cycloaddition, Staudinger ligation, tetrazine reactions, and quadricyclane formation.
• The method allows for the introduction of resonance sites into a sample that does not inherently possess them, enhancing specificity and increasing scattering cross-section.
	• Resonance sites can be introduced by coupling intrinsic structures of the sample to a first reaction partner, and then coupling the first reaction partner to a further reaction partner.
• The method can be used to tag non-resonant background structures, providing a stable and reproducible background signal for improved quantitative analysis.
	• Advantages of using bioorthogonal reactions in CARS microscopy include increased sensitivity, specificity, and reproducibility.
• Examples of bioorthogonal reactions suitable for the method include modified Huisgen cycloaddition, nitrone dipolar cycloaddition, and norbornene cycloaddition.
	• The method involves a two-stage reaction process, where intrinsic chemical structures of the sample are coupled to a coupler molecule, which is then coupled to a reaction partner carrying the resonance site.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources.
	• Allows comparison of "gold standard" segmentations against those from clinicians in training or different software systems.
	• Inputs segmentations recorded in electronic files and converts them to volume models for comparison.
• The comparison process identifies common, missing, and extra volume elements between the segmentations.
	• Measures the conformance between the segmentations based on the number of missing and extra volume elements.
	• Can be used for quality assurance of autosegmentation routines or evaluation of new imaging technology.
• Provides an apparatus for automatically assessing radiation therapy segmentations.
	• Compares volume models to identify common, missing, and extra volume elements.
	• Outputs a measure of conformance between the segmentations based on a metric method.
	• Allows customization of metric methods and provides graphical representation of the evaluation results.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to data processing systems and apparatus for executing floating point operations.
	• Floating point format represents numerical quantities with a fraction value and an exponent argument value.
		• Allows manipulation of a wider range of numbers in data processing systems.
		• Addition and subtraction operations in floating point format are complex and time-consuming.
		• Effective addition and subtraction operations are defined to simplify the process.
	• Accelerating the effective subtraction operation is a key objective of the invention.
		• Subset differences in operand exponent arguments are used to initiate subtraction procedures.
		• Acceleration techniques are employed based on the difference between subsets of exponent arguments.
		• Acceleration is achieved by starting the operation before complete operand argument differences are determined.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides a method for tracking specimens acquired from patients in a medical facility, utilizing unique machine-readable codes on patient ID bands, order forms, specimen containers, and blood drawer badges.
    • The method involves storing these codes in a computer storage, ensuring the patient and order codes are related, and generating signals to acquire and store specimens in the correct containers.
    • Each code encodes specific information, such as patient details, order specifics, and vial expiration dates, to streamline the specimen collection process and reduce errors.
    • The system includes a computer, computer storage, and barcode reading means to facilitate the tracking and processing of patient specimens with high accuracy and efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device for golfers, utilizing GPS and voice recognition technology.
	• The device can be incorporated into headgear, such as a hat, and provides distance and other information verbally to the user.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides a system and method for accurately reporting design errors in different regions of an integrated circuit, such as logic and memory areas.
    * Customized design rules are created by modifying standard logic rules to accommodate the specific requirements of memory regions.
    * The system categorizes errors based on different types of regions, such as logic, BDSP SRAM, BLSP SRAM, DP SRAM, and ROM groups.
    * By applying the right set of rules to the right regions, false errors are eliminated, and the design verification process is more efficient.

</summary>

<summary>
• Thin substrate waveguides can be used for controlled illumination of objects like holograms and spatial light modulators.
	• Waveguide holograms (WGH) provide high diffraction efficiencies and compact, rugged arrangements.
• WGH illuminators occupy less space compared to conventional lens systems.
	• Global and local diffraction efficiencies need to be considered for WGH illuminators.
• WGHs tend to produce two diffracted beams, which can reduce efficiency and introduce noise.
	• Light dispersion can occur if light enters the waveguide at an angle, but this can be addressed with input gratings.
• Aligning sensitivity can be managed by attaching the light source securely or using spatially and spectrally broad sources.
	• Compensation for illumination depletion can be done a priori or a posteriori.
• Solutions for two-sidedness include absorbing light from one side, using mirrors, or employing off-axis illumination.
	• Different recording configurations can be used for WGH holograms, with experiments showing promising results for illuminating objects like SLMs.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to testing squirrel cage rotors for induction motors to identify defects.
    • Background: Squirrel cage rotors are mass-produced with high quality, but defects can still occur.
        • Deficiencies include porosity, impurities, open circuits, and poor insulation.
        • Prior art methods for testing rotors have limitations and require operator interpretation.
        • The new method and apparatus aim to provide non-destructive testing of rotors.
        • It focuses on measuring resistance, reactance, and effective skew of the rotor.
• Test apparatus: Includes test heads with exciting means, voltage sensing, current sensing, and processing means.
    • Skew sensing means can also be included to measure effective electrical skew.
        • Skew is determined by the skew pick-up coil in the test head.
        • Skew is calculated based on the skew pick-up signal and the number of turns in the coil.
• Data acquisition and processing: Involves sampling voltage, current, and skew signals synchronously with the exciting current.
    • Data is processed to calculate resistance, reactance, and effective skew of the rotor.
        • Resistance is calculated using power and current values.
        • Reactance is calculated based on voltage, current, and power values.
• Control processor: Determines mean resistance, reactance, and effective skew from multiple test values.
    • Compares calculated values to predetermined thresholds for pass/fail determinations.
        • Statistical information is stored for analysis over multiple tests.
        • Results are displayed on a terminal and can be printed for record-keeping.
</summary>

<summary>
* Mobile devices can be secured by granting managed libraries access to native resources based on validated digital certificates.
  * Managed applications are denied access to native resources unless authorized by a digital certificate associated with a managed library.
* An arbitration layer, including a manager and a runtime host, can control access to native resources and ensure security of third party code.
  * The manager authorizes requests from managed applications to access native resources through managed libraries.
  * The runtime host executes the requests and accesses the native system resources.
* Executables are verified for type-safe code, dependencies, and header fields before being stored in digitally signed containers for distribution.
  * Managed metadata is inspected at runtime to ensure type-safe code.
  * Executables are validated for managed dependencies and header field values.
</summary>

<summary>
* Identification card with internal antenna and IC chip
    * Smart cards with IC chips are common for transactions
    * Prior art cards use rigid core and glue or mechanical means to secure components
    * Applicants' invention uses shock-absorbing layers to protect IC chip and antenna
* Core layer made of silica-filled polyolefin
    * Antenna and chip fixed to core layer
    * Bottom sheet attached to core layer to envelop components
* Alkyd resin spids with anti-binding agent printed on core layer
    * First laminate layer attached to core layer
    * Second laminate layer attached to bottom sheet
* Process involves pre-shrinking core layer, printing indicia, and bonding layers
    * Image-receiving layer for dye diffusion thermal transfer printing
    * Protective layer applied over image-receiving layer
* Alternate embodiment uses inkjet receiver coating for personalization
    * Inkjet printing done before addition of polyester layers
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to implementing a FIFO queue in a memory, specifically in functional memories using a copy-on-write updating procedure.
    * In traditional FIFO queue implementations, updates require copying the entire queue, which is inefficient for functional memories.
    * The invention uses a tree-shaped structure to implement the queue, reducing the amount of copying required for updates.
    * Updates in the functional environment are faster and require less memory space due to the logarithmic dependency on the queue length.

* A preferred embodiment adds a header node to the structure, improving update efficiency.
    * The header node includes pointers to the end and beginning of the queue, as well as the tree structure.
    * Additions are made to the end node first, then to the tree, while deletions start from the beginning node.
    * The header node includes an inversion bit to indicate the direction of the queue, allowing for constant time and space queue inversion.

</summary>

<summary>
• EPROM devices of the present invention utilize existing DRAM manufacture technologies to build embedded EPROM devices, reducing manufacturing costs and allowing for programmable redundancy circuits in DRAM devices.
	• EPROM coupling capacitors in these devices have higher capacitance, leading to lower operation voltages and simplified supporting circuits.
	• SEPROM devices use transistor properties changed under stress conditions to store data, providing a cost-effective and secure solution for embedded applications.

• SEPROM devices can be manufactured using any IC technologies, ideal for embedded applications and security purposes.
	• Data stored in SEPROM devices is not detectable by physical analysis, providing a secure storage solution.
	• While writing data to SEPROM devices may take longer and they cannot be re-programmed multiple times, the stress damage can partially recover and data can be refreshed periodically.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to determining the optimum value of feedback gain for feedback control.
    * Feedback control involves detecting error, calculating correction amount, and correcting steering angle.
    * Different systems like P, PI, PD, and PID are used to calculate correction amount based on error.
    * The method involves provisionally determining feedback gain, executing feedback control, detecting error, calculating evaluation value, and determining feedback gain based on evaluation value.
* The method uses evaluation functions like LR, Svv, and Asv to evaluate the stability, accuracy, and response of control.
    * LR evaluates the stability based on error variations over time.
    * Svv evaluates accuracy based on the integral of error.
    * Asv evaluates response based on the integral of the absolute value of error.
* The optimum values of P, I, and D gains are determined by analyzing the evaluation functions.
    * The P gain is determined by minimizing LR.
    * The I gain is determined by minimizing Svv.
    * The D gain is determined by minimizing Asv.
* The method can be applied to different subjects of control and provides a quick and accurate way to determine feedback gain values.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and good optical performance.
	* Specifically designed for photographic and video cameras.
* Video cameras require high relative aperture due to low sensitivity of image pickup elements.
* Current trend is towards smaller 8mm video cameras with 1/2 inch image pickup tubes.
* Proper design rules are crucial for achieving high relative aperture without compromising optical performance.
* Increasing refractive power alone can lead to increased aberrations.
* Specific conditions need to be met for the construction and arrangement of lens units.
* Examples of specific zoom lenses are provided with numerical data.
* The invention allows for a reduction in the size of the zoom lens while maintaining high optical performance.
* Total length of the zoom lens can be reduced to as short as 9.13φ A to 9.19φ A.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles in a detector by generating charge pulses and converting them into electric signals.
	* The method allows for the detection of individual particles and integration of signals at high count rates without prior knowledge of expected rates.
* Discharging of charge pulses from the detector is performed on the low-voltage side to improve signal/noise ratio.
	* This prevents leakage current detection and enables precise measurement of detector current.
* Signals are separated based on rate, with a capacitor preceding the fast amplifier for low-rate signals and an inductive element preceding the slow amplifier for high-rate signals.
	* This allows for detection and integration of signals at overlapping rates.
* Detector material can be doped or coated with a converter material for detecting uncharged particles.
	* Materials enabling fast charge transport at room temperature, like diamond, are recommended for wide signal rate ranges.
* The method and device can be used in particle accelerators, reactor installations, and diagnostic devices like X-ray and CT scanners.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches.
	• Clutches connect rotational power from an engine to a transmission via a pressure plate and driven disc assembly.
	• The driven disc assembly must be within specific tolerances to function properly.
• A prior test fixture manually checked the warpage of driven disc assemblies.
	• The fixture was slow, required manual operations, and lacked external indication of test results.
• The improved apparatus automatically checks driven disc assemblies for warpage.
	• It includes an enclosure, torque motor, movable ring, and position sensor.
	• The apparatus measures the distance between rings, applies torque to the driven disc assembly, and checks for rotation to determine warpage.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to face age-estimation in image processing.
	* Difficulty in face recognition and age-estimation is due to variations in human faces.
* Accurate age-estimation is important for various applications like security, business, and media control.
	* Factors influencing face aging include gender, ethnicity, heredity, and environmental factors.
* Computer science approaches to face aging are relatively new compared to other fields.
	* Face age-estimation involves recognizing ages in photos and predicting future faces.
* A Contourlet Appearance Model (CAM) algorithm is used for feature extraction in face age-estimation.
	* CAM combines shape and texture models to extract robust facial features.
* Support Vector Regression (SVR) and Support Vector Machines (SVM) are used for age classification and aging functions.
	* The system extracts feature vectors from images, classifies as youth or adult, and estimates age based on aging functions.
* The system can provide estimated ages with confidence factors and may be implemented on a computing system.
</summary>

<summary>
* Matrix display device for displaying two merged images
    * Applies to simultaneous display of images from different sources
    * Uses arrangements of pixels to display images with different resolutions
    * Can combine monochrome and two-color images
    * Provides contrast reinforcement for better visibility
    * Can display multiple combined images with different colors
</summary>

<summary>
* A mobile identification transmitter for a motor vehicle security system includes a payment element that can be removed from the housing, allowing for various payment actions.
	* The payment element can communicate with a payment system and has credit/debit card functions, as well as a storage device and microprocessors for security.
* The housing has a receptacle for the payment element, which can be sealed with a closure to protect contact elements and electronics.
	* The closure can be a dummy plug or a cap, movably mounted on the housing, and can be activated intentionally by the user.
* An energy storage device supplies current to the electronics and payment element, and the communication means can serve both the security system and the payment system.
	* Cashless payment transactions can be carried out at a point of sale, with secure communication between the payment element and the payment system.
</summary>

<summary>
* An imaging device becomes inactive when not in use and may enter a "sleep mode" to save energy.
    * Toner in the device is charged with a tribo-electro-static charge, which affects image quality.
    * Methods for charging toner based on periods of inactivity are described.
    * An apparatus for charging toner in an imaging device is also discussed.
* The system includes an inactivity determining section, a user usage pattern determining section, and a predicting section.
    * A measuring section measures the toner charge level, and a calculating section determines decay.
    * An updating section updates information, and a storing section stores user patterns and sensor levels.
* Two methods for charging toner are outlined, one based on predicted usage and the other on sensor level differences.
    * The methods involve calculating decay, adjusting toner charge levels, and performing marking operations.
    * The disclosed methods can be implemented in software or hardware, and variations are possible.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus for controlling the recording and reproduction of signals by plural heads with high precision.
    • The apparatus includes MR heads connected to a recording/regenerative integrated circuit for precise control.
    • Bias currents are used to keep the MR heads in a linear operating region.
    • Control signals are transmitted via a rotary transformer to control bias currents for the MR heads.
    • The apparatus allows independent regulation of bias currents for MR heads mounted on a rotary drum.
    • The control signals prioritize head switching and bias current control data for high precision.
    • The invention can be applied to various types of recording/reproducing apparatuses with multiple heads.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, especially when a second object is adjacent to the first.
	• Two general techniques for locating buried metallic objects are passive (using a gradiometer) and active (using a transmitter and receiver).
• The model MAC-51B Magnetic and Cable Locator can be used for selective active or passive use to locate and trace cables or pipes.
	• When a second cable is present adjacent to the first, tracing the desired cable may become difficult due to signal distortion.
• The invention provides a system and method to improve the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing concealed objects in the presence of adjacent objects.
	• The system includes a transmitter with two antennae to induce distinguishable alternating currents in the objects and a receiver to sense magnetic fields associated with the currents.
• Different techniques are employed to make the currents distinguishable and produce an output signal dependent on the presence of both currents.
	• These techniques include using different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, or pulsing at different repetition rates.
• The transmitter is optimally positioned relative to the cables to produce distinct output signal nulls over each cable.
	• The receiver is swept back and forth across both cables to facilitate positioning of the transmitter and monitor the total output signal characteristic.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network for hands-free automatic answering and communication.
	• The apparatus includes a timer for controlling the length of time of the interconnection and a bypass switch for extending the call duration.
• The system is designed to be portable and easily connectable to existing telephone systems through a modular setup.
	• It is particularly useful for individuals with limited mobility or in situations where handling a phone is difficult or dangerous.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention focuses on optical fiber communications and branch powered amplification within network design.
    • Optical fiber amplifiers have significantly increased transmission capacities for digital data.
    • The need for reliable undersea lightwave systems with multipoint-to-multipoint connectivity is emphasized.
    • Trunk and branch structures in a ring network enhance network survivability in case of cable cuts.
• The invention reduces or eliminates the need for undersea optical repeaters by using remotely pumped optical amplifiers.
    • Optical fiber cable trunk in ring topology with telecommunications hubs and branching units are key components.
    • Light emitting power sources are used to provide energy for optical amplifiers in the network.
    • The system allows for signal amplification without the use of conventional optical repeaters.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is directed to cover plate devices for wiring devices in ganged boxes mounted in building walls.
    * Prior art methods involved using screws to attach cover plates, resulting in exposed fasteners.
        * U.S. Pat. No. 4,873,396 attempted to hide fasteners with an M-shaped groove, but had limitations.
        * The present invention provides a two-part device with an attachment member and a cover plate member.
        * The cover plate member has no visible fastener holes and can be easily installed or removed.
        * The attachment member is symmetrical and includes latching pawls for securing the cover plate.
    * The cover plate device can accommodate irregularities in the wall and is available for different numbers of wiring devices.
        * For even numbers of wiring devices, there are an odd number of tabs and slots, and an even number of pawls and racks.
        * For odd numbers of wiring devices, there are an even number of tabs and slots, and an odd number of pawls and racks.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a collapsible light-shielding device for screens, such as television sets and monitors.
	* It consists of concentric annular strips that can be fixed in front of a screen and slide over each other to cover or uncover the screen.
* The device can be folded around the screen to save space and easily attached using Velcro.
	* Strips have decreasing wall thickness, allowing for different viewing angles without obstruction.
* Strips have hook and locking elements for reliable folding and unfolding.
	* An adapter member provides a flat attachment face for the device, fitting various monitor types.
* The device is made of few parts, is inexpensive, reliable, and easy to install.
	* Strips can be solid or bent plate material with integrated hooks and locking elements.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention aims to automatically inform a speaker to decrease their speaking rate when it exceeds a rate that a listener can comprehend.
  * The method involves detecting the language being spoken and setting a speaking rate threshold based on the listener's proficiency with the language.
* The system includes components such as a microphone, sensory mechanism, speaking rate processor, and wireless transceiver to monitor and notify the speaker to adjust their speaking rate accordingly.
  * The method also allows for a language change option if the speaker and listener share a different language, with different thresholds set for comprehension.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a device for optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera.
	• It aims to provide a higher picture sequence frequency with simple means.
• The device includes means for deviating and suppressing the beam to scan over N lines of a picture plane.
	• A cyclic line counter counts line pulses and supplies an end-of-count pulse after p line pulses.
	• A sawtooth generator controls the vertical deviation of the beam.
• The line counter is programmable, allowing for flexibility in adjusting the resolution in time.
	• The device can increase the picture sequence frequency by a factor of 40 compared to conventional TV cameras.
• The video signals can be digitized for analysis and stored in a data processing device.
	• The device is suitable for recording IR, UV, or X-ray pictures.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention integrates voice calls with multimedia sessions as blended calls.
    • Blended calls combine voice and multimedia functions into a single communication session.
    • A multimedia server with blender software manages blended calls.
    • Incoming calls are directed to the blender if the recipient supports blended calling.
• Outgoing calls from clients with blended capabilities are processed through the blender.
    • The blender initiates voice and multimedia components for the call.
    • The multimedia server controls the signaling paths and bearer paths of the call components.
    • SIP is used for setting up and tearing down parallel call components.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is related to electronic service delivery and content synchronization frameworks for connected devices.
	* Existing data synchronization methods are limited in their ability to synchronize based on arbitrary attributes, distribute data sets geographically, and determine synchronization order.
* The present invention provides a method for content synchronization using dynamic attributes and file bundles for connected devices.
	* The method involves accepting context from a client device, constructing a response with file description bundles, prioritizing download order, downloading files, confirming complete download, and rejecting incomplete bundles.
* A content synchronization framework includes a central reference point, servers hosting files, software for sending client context, and network connectivity.
	* The framework supports synchronous and asynchronous interaction, multiple languages, and transport optimization for low bandwidth connections.
* The method involves sending a synchronization request with context and dynamic attributes, constructing a response bundle, prioritizing file download order, responding to the client, creating a delta list of bundle files, downloading files, confirming download, and rejecting incomplete bundles.
	* Resumption of synchronization from specific bundle failures, caching common server responses, and efficient data synchronization are supported.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a system for communication between finders and owners of lost objects.
    * Owners are provided with tags containing unique IDs and virtual locales.
    * Owners register their contact information and tag IDs on a centralized database.
    * Owners can view open cases, edit account settings, and manage tag information.
* Finders access a website using the tag information to communicate with owners.
    * Finders can register, log in, view open cases, and send messages to owners.
    * Finders can search for IDs, send one-way messages, and open new cases.
* The system handles incoming emails and messages from finders to owners.
    * Emails are forwarded to the real email addresses of owners.
    * Messages are also sent to owners' designated instant messaging platforms.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is related to electron multipliers used in photomultipliers and particle detectors.
    * Specifically, the invention focuses on foil electron multipliers for electron spectrometers, mass spectrometers, and photonic detectors.
    * Two types of conventional electron multipliers are discrete dynode multipliers and continuous electron multipliers.
    * The foil electron multiplier design offers advantages over other types of electron multipliers.
* The foil electron multiplier uses a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to multiply electrons in transmission stages.
    * An electrical power supply is connected to the foils and anode to accelerate electrons through the foils.
    * The gain of the foil electron multiplier is maximized by optimizing foil thickness, material selection, and applied voltage.
    * The foil electron multiplier design eliminates ion feedback, which is a common issue in continuous electron multipliers.
* Foil dimensions and thickness are related to the material selected for foil composition.
    * Carbon is the preferred foil material due to its thinness and uniformity.
    * A supporting grid may be required for thin foils to provide structural support.
    * The foil electron multiplier design includes resistors between foil stages and anode for voltage distribution.
</summary>

<summary>
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope invention uses a system to view motion pictures with a 3-dimensional effect by detecting lateral motion.
	* Utilizes Pulfrich effect to control the darkness of lenses in viewer glasses.
* The Glass Lens Controller Unit includes a digital sensor, processor, and battery to process images and control lens darkness.
	* Digital sensor converts light to numerical pixel values for processing.
	* Processor runs a lens control algorithm to identify synchronization events and control lens states.
* Lens control algorithm uses an intensity edge finding algorithm to detect vertical edges and determine motion direction.
	* Sets lenses to clear-clear if no motion is detected, clear-dark for left-to-right motion, and dark-clear for right-to-left motion.
* Decision rule reevaluates synchronization events throughout viewing to adjust lens states accordingly.
	* Determines type of synchronization event and sets lenses based on left-to-right or right-to-left motion.
</summary>

<summary>
• The method involves forming trenches along scribe lines on a semiconductor wafer, applying mechanical pressure to the wafer to singulate individual die.
    • Photo resist layer is applied and patterned on the wafer to protect underlying circuitry.
    • Trenches are etched along scribe lines, adhesive tape is applied to the back surface of the wafer, and pressure is applied to singulate the die.
    • The process can be used on any sized wafer or type of die, and variations in the depth of trenches and back-grinding thickness are possible.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a field emission display device with a protection structure to prevent damage to field emission elements.
  * The protection structure includes reduction plates or electrodes on the cathode to deflect ionized gases away from the field emission components.
* Field emission display devices offer advantages over LCDs, such as higher contrast ratio, larger viewing angle, and lower power consumption.
  * In an FED, electrons are emitted from a cathode and impinge on phosphors to produce an image.
* The protection structure in the FED device alters the discharge path of ionized gases to prevent electrical surges that could damage the field emission elements.
  * Multiple reduction plates can be arranged parallel to rows of field emission elements or in a meshwork pattern among the elements.
* The reduction plates are connected to a bias voltage source to attract positive nitrogen and oxygen ions away from the cathode.
  * The protection structure prolongs the lifetime of the field emission elements and prevents burnout damage.
* Fabrication of the FED device involves depositing metal layers, etching cathode strips, and forming reduction plates using photolithography techniques.
  * The reduction plates are separated from the cathode by an insulating layer and are connected to a bias voltage source to maintain a negative charge.
</summary>

<summary>
* Image sensor with multiple imaging planes
  * Overcomes limitations of prior art CCD sensors
  * Allows recording of information through an edge surface
* Semiconductor substrate with P-type material
  * Includes imaging planes on top surface and edge surfaces
  * Image sensor elements with charge collection and transfer means
* P + layers guide charge carriers towards CCDs
  * Prevents charge carriers from being lost to recombination
  * Charge carriers diffused laterally towards CCDs
* Energy band diagram illustrates effect of increased doping levels
  * Carriers guided back towards middle of substrate
  * Carriers collected in CCD storage regions
* Second embodiment extends N-type regions to edges
  * Improves charge collection and reduces crosstalk
  * Suitable mounting arrangement for image sensor
* Bond pads shifted to ends to avoid interference
  * Opaque coating on die edges to prevent stray light
  * Can be used for color applications with filters
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to home networks with power management systems.
	• Power management is important to reduce energy consumption in home networks.
		• Network appliances can consume a lot of power even when not in use.
		• Energy Star guidelines require devices to reduce power consumption when not in use.
	• Methods are provided for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device.
		• This allows for minimizing total power consumption while ensuring network functions are performed.
		• The network master node can transfer functions to a slave node before entering power save mode.
	• Selection criteria for transferring functions include visibility and intelligence/functional capabilities of the slave node.
		• The slave node can accept the transfer request and become the new master node.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to arrangements of antenna elements to measure the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation.
    • Antennae have been used to determine the angle of arrival of signals, but low elevation angles are challenging due to ground reflections.
    • UK Patent No. 1449196 describes a triplet arrangement of antenna elements that can measure elevation angles independent of ground reflection coefficient.
• The triplet arrangement optimizes angle measurements over selected sectors at low elevation angles.
    • The signal amplitude is the natural output of a radio receiver and is advantageous for post-detection signal processing.
    • At low elevation angles, the signal strength simplifies to a function dependent on the antenna element pattern, transmitted power, range, and elevation angle.
• An antenna array for radio interferometric techniques includes at least four antennae arranged in equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane.
    • Radio receiver means obtain information signals from each antenna, with amplitude and phase relative to other antennae being functions of elevation angles and ground reflection coefficient.
    • Logic means combine information signals to provide derived signals, which are then divided to obtain a quotient signal independent of ground reflection coefficient.
• The array can operate in receive or transmit mode, with coherent carriers required for transmissions within each triplet.
    • The array can provide unambiguous angle measurements and high measurement accuracy for various applications.
    • Practical embodiments of antenna arrays are shown, with optimized values for spacing and height of antenna elements.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to high intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamps, subminiature lamps, lamp assemblies, and a lamp system with a liquid tight seal.
   • Traditional subminiature lamps use adhesive to support the glass envelope within a metal sleeve, leading to degradation over time.
   • Adhesive breakdown is caused by thermal cycling, shearing movement, liquid cleaning procedures, and moisture causing corrosion.
• The new subminiature lamp assembly uses a high temperature polymer to surround and compress the glass envelope, providing extended axial length sealing, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack.
   • The polymer material is rigid, manually handled, and can withstand high temperatures.
   • A fluoroelastomer, such as VITON®, is a preferred material for the seal supported lamp assembly.
• The polymeric seal support eliminates the need for adhesive, allowing for closer tolerance centering of the glass envelope to the base.
   • The seal length is longer than traditional o-ring seals, providing a better seal.
   • The polymeric seal support makes a static radial seal with the glass envelope surface.
• Potting material, such as silicone, can be added under the glass envelope to stabilize the leads and protect them.
   • The potting material minimizes air volume within the lamp, preventing the ingress of harmful substances.
   • Assembly involves inserting the abbreviated base into the polymeric seal support, backfilling with potting material, and securing the leads.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to precoder configuration in MIMO systems.
	• GDFE based precoders provide optimal capacity solutions for MU-MIMO wireless systems.
		• However, the computational cost can be prohibitive for practical systems.
	• Various precoding techniques aim to optimize system capacity or bit error rate.
		• Techniques such as Block Diagonalization and Tomlinson-Harashima Precoding have been proposed.
		• The GDFE Precoder achieves high system capacity but has high computational costs.
	• The described implementation of a GDFE Precoder reduces computational costs without loss of capacity.
		• It relaxes the requirement for knowledge of the covariance matrix corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise."
		• The technique provides a uniform framework for realizing a GDFE Precoder.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and housing, specifically an axial fan with increased intake airflow rate.
   • Conventional fans dissipate heat from electrical elements in closed housings to prevent overheating.
   • The new fan design includes an outwardly extending sidewall to enlarge intake airflow area without changing assembly conditions.
   • The sidewall extension allows for increased airflow rate and enhanced heat-dissipating efficiency.
   • The passage formed by the sidewall gradually reduces in cross-sectional area to concentrate air streams towards the center for better heat dissipation.
   • The housing design can be symmetrical with outward extensions on both the air inlet and outlet sides.
   • The fan can be used with a heat sink to dissipate heat from electrical elements, further enhancing cooling efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
* Electroluminescent display panel able to display images in different colors
    * Based on Japanese Patent Applications
    * Suitable for instrument panels in automobiles
    * No need for intermediate electrode
    * First luminescent layer emits green light
* Second luminescent layer emits orange light
    * Display color changes by adjusting driving voltage
    * Red color filter can be added for additional color options
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, including audio means, converting means, and protocol means.
   • The terminal establishes a wireless connection to a connecting unit for network/Internet access.
   • The terminal can handle data in a standardized Internet/network protocol, such as TCP/IP.
• The system includes the terminal, a connecting unit, and a service server for managing connections between users, providing additional services, and facilitating communication.
   • The service server stores user information, establishes connections between users, and can provide functionalities like news, music, and chat rooms.
</summary>

<summary>
• Germanium buffer layer on Si prevents formation of low dielectric constant layer
	• Allows epitaxial growth of high dielectric constant oxide on conductor or semiconductor
• SrTiO3 or BaTiO3 buffer layer between Pb-containing ferroelectric and Ge coated Si substrate
	• Acts as chemical barrier and nucleates desired perovskite structure
</summary>

<summary>
* Receiver input circuits with preamplifier and mixer arrangements are used in radio and TV receivers.
  * The circuits aim to balance small and large signal behavior while keeping production costs low.
* The Siemens publication "Semiconductor Circuitry Examples" discusses TV tuner circuitry examples.
  * The circuits use PIN diode control networks for amplification control to protect components from distortions.
* Another Siemens publication describes an FM radio receiver circuit with amplification control using a PIN diode network.
  * The control signal is derived from the IF signal to prevent overloading due to strong signals.
* The invention introduces a receiver input circuit with multiple amplification control loops.
  * The control signals are derived from different points in the circuit to regulate amplification.
* An embodiment of the circuit includes PIN diodes for amplification control in the input network.
  * The PIN diodes protect components from overloading and distortion.
* Further developments include extended reactance networks and tunable selective circuits for higher selectivity.
  * The circuits adjust source impedance for the preamplifier transistor during control to amplify the control effect.
* An embodiment features a tunable network with separate tuning voltage adjustment for varactor diodes.
  * This allows for iteration-free alignment of all tuning circuits in the receiver input section.
* Another embodiment uses a single twin diode for the resonant circuits with inductive coupling and a common tuning voltage.
  * This ensures a high degree of identity in the C (U) characteristic of the varactor diodes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to network implemented shared workspace environments
    * Specifically for setting up collaborative work-sharing environments between physically distant individuals
    * Examples include video conferencing, document sharing, and shared whiteboard systems
    * Current PC-based products like Intel's ProShare and Microsoft's NetMeeting are more economical and easier to deploy than dedicated equipment
    * The system allows for spontaneous setup of shared workspaces between parties on a telephone call without complex setup processes
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to inserting advertising clips into video sequences.
    * Microsoft's VideoSense tool is used to select relevant clips and insert them at key moments in the video.
    * The method optimizes the visual impact of the advertising clip by considering the regions of interest in the video sequence and the advertising clip.
* A salience map is generated for the video sequence and each advertising clip.
    * The degree of similarity between the salience maps is calculated to select the advertising clip with the highest similarity.
    * The selected clip is inserted at the insertion point in the video sequence.
</summary>

<summary>
• Recessed mask structure used to prevent high electrical fields in small semiconductor devices
	• Helps reduce leakage and breakdown in sub 250 nanometer devices
	• Provides lower capacitance and faster signal propagation in interconnect wiring
</summary>

<summary>
* The Downconverting Digitizer utilizes predictive coding principles to implement a simple down converting A/D converter.
  * The sampler element converts the loop error signal from an analog to a digital representation.
* The predictive filter plays a central role in the operation of the Downconverting Digitizer, generating a prediction of the modulated IF signal at the next sampling epoch.
  * The predictive filter increases the word length of the digital representation, resulting in high dynamic range and lower noise bandwidth.
* The DAC converts the digitally-represented sum of the predictive filter output and the offset nuller correction signal to an analog representation.
  * The number of bits of the DAC is chosen to ensure that the quantization noise introduced is below the noise of the predictive filter.
* The AGC loop maintains the magnitude of the modulated IF signal within the dynamic range of the predictive loop.
  * The AGC loop consists of power detector, summing node, AGC loop gain element, AGC loop filter, and gain control encoder.
* The offset nuller dynamically detects and removes offsets that would impair the analog-to-digital conversion.
  * The offset nuller continuously estimates the size of the offset and removes it during operation.
* The DQM downconverts the output of the predictive filter to baseband in-phase and quadrature components.
  * The DQM is implemented as a simple circuit which routes alternate output samples of the predictive filter to generate the I and Q components.
* The rate reduction filters perform filtering and sample rate reduction of the in-phase and quadrature components.
  * The rate reduction filters are designed to reject the double frequency term and reduce the processing rate of the digitized signal.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to sensors with nanodimensional features that respond to molecular compounds, organisms, or gas molecules.
	* Nanowires and nanotubes are used for label-free detection of biomolecule binding.
		* High-sensitivity detection is achieved by the depletion or accumulation of charge carriers.
		* Conductance changes are associated with hybridization of receptor and target molecules.
		* Nanowires can be fabricated using laser catalytic growth.
		* Photolithography is used for fabrication of micron-scale features.
	* Nanoimprint lithography is used to pattern nano-scale features into a quartz plate template.
		* Features are imprinted into a photoresist layer and transferred to a thin film layer on a wafer.
		* Nanoimprint lithography provides a cost-effective method for fabricating arrays of nano-scale features.
		* Arrays of semiconducting nanotraces are responsive to changes in electrical characteristics for each device.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides a method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages to prevent contamination of lead surfaces.
	• The method involves providing a leadframe with semiconductor dies, partially cutting the leadframe to expose side surfaces of the leads, and plating the exposed side surfaces with a material that does not react with oxygen.
• Different cutting techniques, such as full cutting, partial cutting, and bevel-edged blades, can be used to create straight or beveled side surfaces on the semiconductor packages.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a dual mode mobile terminal connecting to a wireless wide area network and a wireless local network.
	* Fixed Mobile Convergence (FMC) integrates WWAN and WLAN in one system.
* The mobile terminal has two wireless modules - GSM and WiFi - for switching between networks.
	* When signal level from WLAN drops, the mobile terminal switches to WWAN.
* The mobile terminal receives service information from WLAN's access point about neighboring base stations.
	* This information helps the mobile terminal select a serving base station for connecting to WWAN.
* If initial connection fails, the mobile terminal scans frequency channels or performs all channels scanning.
	* The method ensures timely switching from WLAN to WWAN to avoid dropped connections.
</summary>

<summary>
* New process simplifies the manufacture of multilayered components
    * Process includes providing electrodes and components on decals
    * Sub-assemblies are stacked to form resultant assemblies
    * Eliminates costly steps like cutting and metallizing
* Multiple electrodes and components are formed on separate decals
    * Electrodes are deposited using screening process
    * Components are deposited on electrodes to form sub-assemblies
    * Sub-assemblies are cured and stacked in precise registered relation
* Different configurations of electrodes and components can be used
    * Allows for formation of capacitors, coils, resistances, or combinations
    * Eliminates cutting operation, reducing stress cracks and delamination
    * Provides end terminations for easy interconnection of electrodes
* Process enables fabrication of smaller parts with lower voltage ratings
    * Allows for inspection of electrode and dielectric prints before construction
    * Thinner dielectric can be used due to embedded electrode configuration
    * Provides a variety of tab configurations with no extra process time
* Inventory can be partially carried in decal form for rapid response to customers
    * Enables quick build-up of capacitor plates and configurations as needed
    * Suitable for use with semiconductor devices mounted on silicon substrates
    * Adaptable to manufacturing multilayer ferrite inductors and other electronic ceramic devices
* Method for producing electrical coils involves forming multiple laminates
    * Coils are formed with left or right handed spiral patterns on decals
    * Ferrite ceramic material is deposited on coils to form composites
    * Stacking composites results in fused interengaged terminations to create complete coils
* Interleaving patterns can produce transformer configurations, magnetic amplifiers, and more
    * Possibilities include multilayer substrates, semiconductor packages, and precision registers
    * Series connected resistors, coils, and capacitors can be included in one stack
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to hierarchical lattice structures for structural applications.
   • Sandwich panels typically use lattice structures with trusses of equal size.
   • The lattice structures described have multiple cell sizes for improved stiffness and strength.
• The lattice structures can be nested and mated to form balanced structures.
   • Mating occurs when ligaments of highest order cells abut with those of oppositely oriented lattice structures.
   • Face sheets can be applied to the lattice structures for additional support.
• The lattice structures can be fabricated using injection molding processes.
   • The unit cells can be used as templates for deposition of other materials.
   • The lattice structures can be used in various applications, including impact and blast mitigation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention involves a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons by integrating an IGCC facility with a CTL facility.
    • The process includes wet gasification and dry gasification stages to produce combustion gas and synthesis gas precursor.
    • Hydrocarbons are synthesized from the synthesis gas precursor in Fischer-Tropsch hydrocarbon synthesis stages.
• The process optimizes energy efficiency by combining wet and dry gasification technologies, sharing utilities, and using fuel gas produced by the CTL facility in the IGCC facility.
    • Air separation units are shared, power-producing turbines are integrated with air compressors, and ultra-pure water is shared for steam production.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides a method for preparing a solid device for oxide superconducting material by coating a blocking film on the surface to prevent oxygen removal and controlling oxygen concentration in the material.
